Title: Passages for your own, -surprises- for the enemy - how our sappers work in -brimstone-
Description: The video of combat work appeared on November 11 on the brigade's page. In the Kharkiv region, sappers of the engineering troops make passages in mine-explosive barriers, and leave -surprises- for the occupiers, which give more than a dozen “grave” to Russia -May the flow of black packages to Russia never end,- the brigade commented on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 4th mechanized battalion of the presidential brigade named after Hetman Bohdan Khmelnytskyi, hundreds of ammunition for drones are made every day, mining -under the noses- of the occupiers and building entire underground cities.

Title: Different varieties and equipment: what is the number, composition and quality of the Russian group ...
Description: About the composition and level of training of the Russian invaders in Kurshchyna on the air of the telethon -Soviet News- spoken the spokesman of OTU - Siversk- Colonel Vadym Mysnyk. — In Kurshchyna, both the intensity of shelling and the accumulation of manpower of the enemy's equipment are quite significant. Using their advantage in this, they are constantly trying to carry out assault actions to dislodge our forces from held positions, he said. Based on open sources, the spokesman reported the approximate number of the enemy group in the Kursk region. — There are open sources that can be announced, they are approximately 45-50 thousand people, the officer informed. The increase in the number of the enemy group in Kurshchyna is due to the effective actions of units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. — By the actions of our Defense Forces, we inflict very significant, sensitive losses on the enemy, both in terms of equipment and personnel. They are constantly forced to transfer new reserves here, the military officer emphasized. The spokesman of the OTU -Siversk- reported on the parts that make up the Russian group in the Kursk region. — The units here are of different types, with different configurations. For the most part, the main units are the marine infantry brigades: 155th Pacific Fleet and 810th Black Sea Fleet [Russian Federation], amphibious division, special forces battalion units, assault battalions, motorized infantry. But they collect and throw -meat- here for their assaults, Vadym Mysnyk said. Earlier, ArmyInform explained, for what purpose the enemy does not reduce the intensity of shelling in the North.

Title: A large Lithuanian convoy arrived in Ukraine
Description: As Oleksandr Poronyuk reported for ArmiyaInform, all the drivers of this convoy are citizens of Lithuania, who have already arrived to us several times with a humanitarian mission. Among them are ethnic Ukrainians, in particular, Mykola Dziadzin and Viktor Chernyshuk, head of the public organization -Ukrainian House- in Lithuania. According to Viktor Chernyshuk, this project in Lithuania is called -Big Convoy-. Its peculiarity is that both cars and cargo have their specific destination. Thus, Lithuanian volunteers combined the wishes and needs of Ukrainian defenders. -Our citizens understand very well that Ukrainian soldiers are at the same time defenders of Lithuania. It is very important for us to support and help our brothers with everything we can. All property, medicines, equipment, cars were collected and bought exclusively with Lithuanians' own funds. Someone gave a few euros, someone a few thousand, and we pass all this to the valiant Ukrainian army,- Viktor Chernyshuk noted. It is quite important that this convoy of humanitarian aid started its journey from the Lithuanian Seimas, where they were escorted by ordinary citizens, representatives of local media, authorities and the Ambassador of Ukraine to Lithuania Petro Beshta. The actors of Vilnius theaters also contributed to the creation of this convoy. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine met in Kyiv with a Lithuanian colleague.

Title: A third of the enemy's losses are irreversible: the consequences of six assaults by the occupiers in...
Description: Details about the situation in the north of Kharkiv region and the losses of the Russian occupiers were informed at Kharkiv OTU. the Russian occupiers carried out 5 airstrikes using 6 guided aerial bombs, as well as 44 kamikaze drone strikes, carried out 363 attacks on the positions of Ukrainian defenders. The defense forces respond adequately to the actions of the enemy and continue to effectively destroy the manpower, weapons and military equipment of the Russian occupiers. In addition to the loss of manpower, the enemy also lost destroyed and damaged 48 units of weapons and military equipment, in particular: In addition, in the Kharkiv direction, the Defense Forces of Ukraine destroyed 72 shelters for personnel and ammunition storage sites. Earlier, ArmyInform reported who are the occupiers fighting in Kupyan Oblast .

Title: As a result of the Russian attack on Kryvyi Rih, 8 people were injured, including 2 children
Description: The Dnipropetrovsk military administration announced this on November 11. -There may be people under the rubble. So far, four victims are known. One person is hospitalized,- Oleksandr Vilkul, head of the Kryvyi Rih Defense Council, said. -A 10-year-old girl was treated on the spot. An 11-year-old boy is hospitalized in a moderate condition. 58- and 75-year-old women are hospitalized in the same condition,- the head of the Dnipropetrovsk military administration reported. Sergey Lysak. As reported by ArmyInform, enemy hit Kramatorsk with UMPB D-30SN bombs: dozens of houses were damaged.

Title: Terrorize civilians and shackle the Defense Forces: in the North, the enemy does not reduce the inte...
Description: Colonel Vadym Mysnyk, the spokesman of OTU -Siversk-, explained the purpose of the Russian invaders on the air of the -Suspilne Novosti- telethon . — The tense situation remains on the border with the Russian Federation. The enemy continues to carry out and maintains the intensity of shelling both of border settlements and deep into our regions, he said. At the same time, the occupiers mostly hit the civilian infrastructure, and also try to restrain the units of the Defense Forces stationed in the border zone with their actions. — By carrying out such terrorist attacks on critical infrastructure objects, on civilians, they are also trying to bind our units along the border so that we cannot transfer them to more intensive areas of hostilities, the spokesman explained. Earlier, ArmyInform explained why in Sumshchya shelling of the border is the most.

Title: Self-propelled guns, attack drones, missiles — Ukraine will buy weapons from Denmark at Russian expe...
Description: About this reported on November 11 by the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. The documents finalize the agreements recorded in the Letter of Intent, which was signed at the end of September in Kyiv. They provide for a number of purchases from Ukrainian defense companies for a total amount of approximately 535 million euros. The sources of funding are the governments of Denmark and Sweden and interest from frozen Russian assets. -‎In the conditions of a full-scale war, the support of our international partners is critically important for strengthening Ukraine's defense capabilities. Denmark was the first to start purchasing weapons directly from our defense enterprises. -The Danish model of cooperation is not only solidarity, but also determination in supporting our struggle for freedom and sovereignty,- said Deputy Defense Minister of Ukraine Dmytro Klimenkov. -I am sincerely grateful to the Danish government and all the people for their constant and consistent support. We appreciate that Denmark sets an example in the development of the defense complex of Ukraine. This will allow speeding up the supply of the necessary weapons to our military, while strengthening the Ukrainian economy in the face of Russian aggression. It is extremely important for us to have such a reliable ally as Denmark,- emphasized Herman Smetanin, Minister of Strategic Industries. The Ministry of Defense of Ukraine and the Defense Procurement Agency provided Denmark with comprehensive information on manufacturers, weapon efficiency, production capabilities and compliance with anti-corruption standards. -According to the results of the agreements, Ukrainian manufacturers of arms and equipment, both state and private, will supply the Armed Forces with self-propelled artillery installations, attack drones, anti-tank weapons, and missile weapons,- said the Director of the Procurement Policy Department, Hlib Kanevskyi. Thanks to the -Danish model-, which involves direct financing of manufacturers, Ukraine has already received 50 million euros. These funds were used to finance the production of self-propelled artillery units -Bohdan- for the Armed Forces. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine and Denmark discussed key support within fighter and air defense coalitions.

Title: The enemy hit Kramatorsk with UMPB D-30SN bombs: dozens of houses were damaged
Description: ArmiyaInform correspondents visited the scene. The enemy hit the private housing sector. According to the police of the Donetsk region, the occupiers struck at around 4:35 a.m. with three UMPB D-30SN bombs. As a result of the shelling, two private houses were completely destroyed, and about 30 more were damaged. Nine cars were also damaged. A 68-year-old woman was rescued from the rubble of a residential building and was hospitalized. Currently, part of the district is without electricity, there are problems with gas supply. Communal services eliminate the consequences of the Russian attack. The day before, the Russians dropped five UMPB D-30SN bombs on the Mykolaivka village near Slovyansk. As a result of the strike, one civilian was killed and another was wounded. 6 private houses and an infrastructure facility were destroyed. UMPB D-30SN is a new glide bomb with an additional engine, which has a longer drop range, compared to the UMPK kit. The enemy began to use them in the spring of 2024, initially for strikes on Kharkiv. The peculiarity of the bomb is that it can be launched both from an aircraft (the main carrier is the Su-34 front-line bomber) and from the ground. As reported by ArmyInform, 5 people died in Mykolaiv a> as a result of hitting -Shakhed-. In addition, in Zaporizhzhya as a result of Russian shelling a man died, another 22 people were injured. Photo by Natalia Kravchuk and Ruslana Tarasova

Title: In Sumy Oblast, shelling of the border is the greatest: what is the reason for this
Description: About it on the broadcast of the -Only News- telethon reported the spokesman of the State Border Service of Ukraine Andriy Demchenko. — The enemy does not stop shelling Chernihiv Oblast, Sumy Oblast, and Kharkiv Oblast. I can point out that the majority of shelling occurs in the Sumy region, he said. The DPSU spokesman explained what caused this. — It should be understood that the length of the border within Sumy Oblast is more than 560 km, that is, it is quite significant. The length of the border is shorter within the borders of Chernihiv Oblast, as well as within the borders of Kharkiv Oblast, the border guard noted. At the same time, the enemy's attention to the border of Sumy Oblast is also higher than to the border in neighboring regions. -In the Sumy direction, we can see that the enemy is actively using artillery and unmanned aerial vehicles in this direction, as well as aviation in order to strike along the Sumy region's border,- Andriy Demchenko said. Almost always, the occupiers hit civilian infrastructure and local residents. - These shellings, unfortunately, fall on populated areas, as a result of which civilians living in border areas are killed. There are deaths, injuries to people, and destruction of infrastructure. In fact, Russia does not cease to confirm its status as a terrorist state by taking such actions, he said. At the same time, the spokesman of the State Border Service of Ukraine noted that in the Sumy region, attempts by hostile subversive and reconnaissance groups were also observed, although the number of such attempts or the activity of enemy DRGs has significantly decreased in the last period. Utmi, the enemy has not given up its subversive activities. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that an agent of the Russian Federation was detained in Sumshchyna, and a href=-https://armyinform.com.ua/2024/10/31/shpyguny-dyversanty-bojovyky-vorog-teroryzuye-pivnichnyj-kordon/->the enemy does not stop attacking the Ukrainian northern border - there is regular shelling and the activity of enemy sabotage group.

Title: The head of EU diplomacy visited the units of the Armed Forces of Chernihiv Oblast and inspected the...
Description: This was reported on November 11 by the -North- operational command. The main thing is the operational situation on the border, threats, defense readiness. Also, the foreign partners got acquainted with the process and results of the construction of fortifications in the border regions, talked with the defenders of the Defense Forces of Ukraine. The Vice-President of the European Commission, Mr. Borrell, looked with interest at the samples of equipment and weapons that military personnel use every day in the defense of Ukraine. Among others, the delegation was accompanied by officers of the -North- operational command. According to tradition, the parties exchanged souvenirs and presents. As ArmiyaInform reported, the High Representative of the European Union for Foreign Policy and Security Policy Josep Borrell stated that the Kursk offensive operation of Ukraine dealt a serious blow to the narrative of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

Title: An agent of the Russian Federation was detained in Sumy Oblast
Description: The Sumy Regional Prosecutor's Office reported this on November 11. Under the procedural leadership of the Sumy Regional Prosecutor's Office, a 50-year-old resident of Sumy Oblast was notified of suspicion of treason under martial law (Part 2, Article 111 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). According to the investigation, the man began close cooperation with an employee of the Russian special service in July 2024. On one of the messengers, he received coordinates that he needed to check for the presence of Ukrainian defenders. The man went to the specified area and carefully documented everything. He sent a detailed report, supported by photo evidence and specified coordinates, to his curator. At the moment, at the request of the investigator and the prosecutor, the court decided that the suspect should be kept in custody without the right to bail. As reported by ArmyInform, the Security Service of Ukraine detained an FSB agent who was preparing to set fire to military vehicles and railway facilities in Dnipro.

Title: -Mobs-, -contrachi-, -boots-: who are the occupiers fighting in the Kupyan region
Description: told about the composition of the enemy troops in the Kupyan region on the air of -Social News- Nadiya Zamryga, head of the public relations department of the 14th separate mechanized brigade named after Prince Roman the Great. -The group is quite motley and different, which consists of personnel military occupiers, is mobilized,- she said. Voiskova noted that the level of training of the occupiers should not be underestimated. — They have been mobilized for a long time, that is, this is an enemy who has combat experience, who has a rather long period of training behind him. That is, these are really professional servicemen of the enemy, she said. At the same time, there are also poorly trained mobs. — But there are quite a few recently mobilized who have undergone short, short-term training and have already found themselves on the front lines, the military woman said. The enemy suffers significant losses. Every day in the zone of responsibility of 14 separate mechanized brigades named after Prince Roman the Great, depending on weather conditions and the intensity of hostilities, destroy from 3-5 to more than 10 occupiers. Suffering losses, the occupiers constantly need and receive replenishment. Prisoners talk about this, in particular. Recently, the fighters of the brigade captured two occupiers, who turned out to be recently mobilized. ArmyInform previously reported that navit-vnochi/->in the Kupyan region, the enemy is not allowed to reach the front line even at night.

Title: One person died and 22 were injured as a result of the Russian shelling of Zaporizhzhia
Description: This was reported by Ivan Fedorov, the head of the Zaporizhia Regional State Administration, on the morning of November 11. According to him, a 71-year-old man died. According to data of the State Emergency Service, a two-story residential building was partially destroyed as a result of the bombardment. a dormitory and a car dealership building were damaged. As reported by ArmyInform, 5 people died in Mykolaiv a> as a result of hitting -Shakhed-.

Title: Air Force of the Ukrainian Armed Forces: two missiles were shot down at night and 39 martyrs
Description: This was reported by the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The air attack was repulsed by anti-aircraft missile forces, aviation, electronic warfare units, mobile fire groups of the Air Force and the Defense Forces of Ukraine. As of 09:30, two Kh-59/69 guided air missiles and 39 enemy UAVs were shot down in the Kyiv, Zhytomyr, Poltava, Sumy, Cherkasy, Zaporizhzhia, Chernihiv, Dnipropetrovsk, and Mykolaiv regions. 30 enemy drones were lost in various regions of Ukraine, another 3 Russian UAVs left the airspace of Ukraine in the direction of Belarus and the temporarily occupied territory. As reported by ArmyInform, in Mykolaiv as a result of a strike drone hitting a residential building 5 people died.

Title: The enemy attacked Kharkiv region with anti-aircraft missiles, anti-aircraft missiles, and UAVs: eig...
Description: informed Oleg Synegubov, head of Kharkiv OVA, about the consequences of shelling of populated areas of Kharkiv Oblast by servicemen of the armed forces of Russian intelligence. In Chuguyev, according to notification of the Main Directorate of the National Police of Ukraine in Kharkiv region, the enemy hit the -Shakhed- UAV. An apartment building and 9 cars were damaged in the city. Five civilians were injured. A photo of the consequences of the shelling of Chuguyev was published by the Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office. Law enforcement officers reported that among the victims of shelling of the city is a 40-year-old woman, her 17-year-old daughter and a 10-year-old son, as well as a 36-year-old man. All of them received medical assistance on the spot. In Kupyansk, as reported by the police, the Russians fired with Uragan anti-aircraft missiles. 9 private houses were damaged. Injured civilian woman. The invaders also bombarded the city with FPV drones. The premises of the agricultural enterprise and a car were damaged. In the Kupyansk district, servicemen of the Russian army shelled the settlements of Prikolotne and Vilkhuvatka of the Vilkhuvat community, as well as Kolisnikivka of the Kuriliv community. In Kolisnikivka, according to notification of the Main Directorate of the National Police of Ukraine in Kharkiv region, as a result of shelling, a civilian man and woman were injured. In Prykolotny, enemy strikes hit a civilian enterprise, the elevator premises were damaged, and the windows and doors of the administrative building were damaged. In Vilkhuvatka, an economic building was damaged as a result of shelling. In Kharkiv, an enemy strike hit a forest strip in the Kyiv district of the city. No damage or casualties. In the Kharkiv direction, one skirmish continues near Vovchansk. Five enemy attacks have already been repelled by our defenders in the districts of Starytsia and Vovchansk. The enemy used aviation and carried out three airstrikes, dropping 4 anti-aircraft missiles in the areas of Kharkiv, Vilcha and Vilkhuvatka settlements. The enemy launched three attacks on our fortifications in the Kupyan direction. At this time, all of them in the districts of Kindrashyvka, Zagryzovy and Zeleny Gayu have already been defeated. During the day, 30 people were evacuated from Kupyanskyi and Borivskyi directions. In particular, as reported in the Main Department of the State Emergency Service of Ukraine in the Kharkiv region, rescuers of the State Emergency Service in armored vehicles 2 people were taken to intermediate evacuation points. These are residents of Kivsharivka village, Kupyan district. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that as a result of enemy two women were injured in the attacks in the Kupyan region.

Title: To pieces - our drones conduct autopsies of enemy attack aircraft
Description: The video was published on the battalion channel. The pilots of -Birds of Magyar- used their kamikaze drones to hit the enemy in various parts of the body to show that the occupiers are not welcome on Ukrainian soil. -Please limit the viewing of the video by children,- warned the battalion commander, Capt. Robert Browdy.   As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 414th battalion of unmanned aerial systems -Birds of Magyar- as part of the Marine Corps hit in October 1552 individual Russian targets.

Title: On the rear approaches: in the Kupyan region, the enemy is not allowed to calmly reach the front eve...
Description: Currently, the enemy is trying to storm exclusively in small infantry groups, and the Ukrainian military is destroying the invaders not only on the front line, but also in the rear, not allowing them to accumulate in significant numbers directly on the battle line. told about this on the air -Suspilne novy- Nadiya Zamryga, head of the public relations department of the 14th separate mechanized brigade named after Prince Roman the Great. - The enemy does not abandon the intention of assaults, they carry out them mostly by infantry, because in extreme times, let's say, for a month, heavy equipment is practically not used to transport personnel, - she said. Voiskova explained that there are quite objective reasons for such actions of the enemy. — There are quite objective reasons for this - the enemy's equipment, which was transporting personnel, ammunition and some other things, was destroyed. -Aerial reconnaissance, FPV drones, drops are very effective, and it's all being destroyed,- the officer said. Judging by the effectiveness of the actions of the Ukrainian defenders, the occupiers try to act also at night, but this does not help them. - Uses infantry, small groups. It is worth noting that both during the day and at night. Likewise, this infantry makes incredible efforts, because it is extremely difficult, especially at night, it is all destroyed, said the representative of the princely brigade. The work of Ukrainian drones, which destroy manpower, equipment, fortifications and warehouses of the occupiers, is extremely effective. — We are working to prevent the enemy from moving into attacks and assaults. We try to work effectively with FPV drones, dropping a little further to his rear to destroy his logistics. FPV drones work very efficiently with the contributions of PMM and BC, Nadiya Zamryga explained. The main task of strikes on the near and far rear of the occupiers is to prevent the enemy from accumulating sufficient forces at the front. — We are making every effort to ensure that the enemy does not reach the actual contact line. End Times [the enemy] uses less heavy equipment, but instead uses ATVs and motorcycles. This is a more mobile technique, less loud in sound, but it also manages to destroy it, the spokeswoman emphasized. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in Kharkiv Oblast the enemy has problems with the supply of ammunition.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, strength of spirit, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine , decree: to start a national minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, which should be announced in all mass media, regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: Over the past day, 160 combat clashes have been recorded — the General Staff of the Armed Forces of ...
Description: Operational information as of at 08:00 on November 11 was published by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The aggressor carried out airstrikes, in particular in the areas of the settlements of Yastrubyne, Pishchane, Bereza, Nova Sich, Khotin, Oleksandrivka, Yablunivka, Novenke, Basivka, Kharkiv, Vilcha, Grekivka, Vilkhuvatka, Berestov, Siversk, Mykolaivka, Sloviansk, Chasiv Yar, Toretsk , Kostyantynivka, Shcherbinivka, Lysivka, Kotlyne, Sukha Balka, Oleksandropil, Kurakhove, Katerynivka, Romanivka, Dachne, Andriivka, Zelene Pole, Novodarivka, Velyka Novosilka, Temyrivka, Olhivka. Over the past day, missile troops and artillery of the Defense Forces hit one artillery system and six areas of concentration of personnel and equipment of the Russian invaders. In the Kharkiv direction, the enemy stormed six times in the areas of Staritsa and Vovchansk settlements. There were three attacks by the occupiers in the Kupyan direction during the day. The defense forces repelled enemy assaults near Kindrasivka, Zagryzovy and Zeleny Gay. In the Lyman direction, the enemy attacked six times. He tried to advance near the settlements of Grekivka, Terny, Torske and Serebryanka. The defenders of the Ukrainian land restrained the onslaught of the enemy in the Siverskyi direction, where one attack of the enemy was repulsed in the Verkhnokamyansky district. In the Kramatorsk direction, three clashes were recorded in the areas of Stupochky and Chasovoy Yar. In the direction of Toretsk, the enemy launched 16 attacks near Toretsk and Shcherbinivka. In the Pokrovsky direction, our defenders stopped 35 assault and offensive actions of the aggressor in Myrolyubivka, Promeny, Hryhorivka, Selidovoy, Lysivka, Sukhoi Yar and Petrivka districts. In the Kurakhiv direction, the Defense Forces repelled 48 attacks on the positions of our troops near Illinka, Vozdvizhenka, Novoselidivka, Novodmytrivka, Sontsivka, Maksimilianivka, Antonivka, Dalnye, and Katerynivka. The occupiers most actively tried to advance in the areas of the settlements of Antonivka and Illinka. In the Vremivsk direction, the enemy carried out 13 assaults on our positions in the districts of Trudovoy, Konstantinopolsky, Uspenivka, and Makarivka. Actively used attack and bomber aircraft for strikes on the direction. In the direction of Orihiv, the occupiers attacked twice in the direction of Novoandriivka and Malaya Tokmachka, were strongly repulsed, and suffered losses. In the Dnieper direction, the Russian invaders stormed the positions of our units seven times, these actions did not bring them success. No signs of the formation of enemy offensive groups were detected in the Volyn and Poliske directions. On the border with the Chernihiv and Sumy regions, the enemy from the territory of the Russian Federation is actively using artillery and aviation in the areas of Ukrainian settlements. The operation is ongoing in the Kursk region. According to the available information, the enemy aircraft made 26 strikes with the use of 48 anti-aircraft missiles on its territory over the past day. Our soldiers inflict significant losses in manpower and equipment on the occupying forces and actively undermine the offensive potential of the enemy in the rear. In general, the Russian invaders lost 1,770 people in the past day. Ukrainian soldiers also destroyed 4 tanks, 40 armored combat vehicles, 34 artillery systems, 57 UAVs of operational-tactical level, two cruise missiles, 119 cars and 16 units of special equipment of the occupiers. -Join the Defense Forces! Together we will win! -Glory to Ukraine!- - said in a message from the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, the enemy lost over 1700 soldiers and 40 units of armored vehicles.

Title: In the Moscow region, an attack helicopter Mi-24 — GUR was burned
Description: This was reported by the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine on November 11. The burned enemy helicopter belonged to the 92nd squadron of the 344th center of combat use and retraining of the air force of the army aviation of the Russian Federation. The GUR reminds that for every war crime committed against Ukraine, the occupier will receive a fair punishment. As ArmiyaInform reported, on November 9, 2024, Ukrainian military intelligence intercepted radio talks the North Korean military involved in the war against Ukraine by Russia.

Title: The commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces worked in parts and units in the Kursk direction
Description: He wrote about this on his page on the morning of November 11. -If it weren't for the resilience of our soldiers, these tens of thousands of enemies from the best Russian shock units would have stormed our positions in the Pokrovsky, Kurakhiv or Toretsk directions, which would have significantly worsened the situation at the front. Now, following the order of their military leadership, they are trying to dislodge our troops and advance deep into the territory we control. Our task in this direction is to deter and destroy the enemy on his land,- said the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. According to him, the work was devoted to providing assistance to commanders in the organization of combat operations, increasing the effectiveness of fire damage to the enemy, and solving issues of comprehensive support and preparation of reserves. -I am grateful to our soldiers for their steadfastness and bravery in the fight against the Russian aggressor. Glory to Ukraine!- Oleksandr Syrskyi wrote. As reported by ArmyInform, General Alexander Syrsky held another telephone conversation with the commander of the US armed forces in Europe, General Christopher Cavoli.

Title: The Left Bank, cable crossing and chemical weapons: how the South of Ukraine was defended in the sum...
Description: In the continuation of ArmiyaInform's interview with the spokesman of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Captain Dmytro Lykhoviei, read about Krynky, the left bank of the Dnieper in Kherson Oblast, the Gulyaipil and Orikhov directions and the Robotynsky ledge, as well as the difference between chemical weapons and ammunition with poisonous substances. The first part of the interview: What it's like to be a military spokesperson: Captain Lykhovy on mobilization, civil media and the famous Turkish Olympic shooter - What was the situation in the South of Ukraine in the area of ​​responsibility of the -Tavria- air defense missile system when you were there on a business trip and acted as a spokesperson? - This year I had two business trips. The first - in the operational and strategic group of troops -Tavria-, to the zone of responsibility of which the Avdiyiv direction belonged, the second - in the operational group of troops -Tavria-, in the zone of which were the Kherson and Zaporizhia regions. If in the East during the first mission the situation was tense and controlled, then in the South it was controlled and stabilized. In the huge zone of responsibility of the Tavria anti-aircraft missile system, from the sea to Donetsk region, in August and at the beginning of September, there were sometimes even days when no enemy assaults took place. Often there were several enemy infantry attacks that could be counted on the fingers of one hand. At the same time, about 50 combat clashes per day could take place in the Pokrovsky direction alone, which refers to the Khortytsia air defense system. According to my conclusion, the Russians lacked (and now lack) the forces and means to conduct active offensive actions in many directions at the same time. Although this does not mean that we in Tavria had some kind of -lull-. After all, the enemy actively used artillery, attack aircraft, guided aerial bombs, unguided aerial missiles and other means of destruction every day. —What was the Ukrainian society interested in then, which news reports about the situation in the South attracted the most attention?—The media was most interested in the situation with the withdrawal of units of the Defense Forces of Ukraine from the village of Krynka on the left bank of the Dnieper in the Kherson region. This is actually what started my rotation. It was also about the prospects of the enemy's offensive in the Zaporizhzhia region and details about the nature of the Russian assaults, the results of the combat work of our units in terms of defeating the enemy's personnel, weapons and military equipment, and capturing them. I can single out the regular comments I gave for regional media. We have developed very high-quality cooperation with Zaporizhia and Kherson media regarding the situation in specific regions. I prepared for them special information reports on shades in these areas, which took into account the specifics there. I would like to single out the local editorial offices of -Suspilny- as an example of the high-quality work of regional media. —You mentioned Krynyk. Was it possible to communicate this moment with the bridgeheads on the left bank of the Dnieper, to explain to society what is happening there and why exactly this is happening? — The beginning of my rotation at the Strategic Communications Center of the Taviya Air Force Base fell on the period when, in July, units of the Defense Forces — marines and others - finally withdrew from the village of Krynky on the left bank Dnipro. After all, this settlement was completely destroyed by a long-term complex fire attack on the part of the Russians, there was no longer anything to hold on to. Actually, Krynky ceased to be a settlement a long time ago. At the same time, our troops continued to hold other designated positions and bridgeheads on the left bank of the Kherson region, not allowing the enemy to take control of the Dnieper riverbed. In particular, intensive combat operations by units of the Armed Forces of Ukraine continued with the Russian invaders on the islands in the Dnipro river delta - Milky, Kozatskyi, Bilogrudiy and a number of others. The specifics of the terrain there are such that it is difficult to use a significant force of attack aircraft and armored vehicles, instead, you have to use boats, jet skis, etc. for logistics. These enemy vessels were regularly destroyed by our forces. At one point, even a rope crossing across one of the straits was affected. - And how did the occupiers act in other areas - where there were no such water obstacles? - As a rule, the Russian occupiers carried out assault operations in small infantry groups of up to a detachment. Sometimes it was from 3-4 to 8-10 people. Attacked without the use of armored vehicles, but with extensive use of light equipment, ranging from motorcycles, buggies and the like. For the first time to resort to such tactics, in my memory, they started in February-March 2024. Half a year later, mass use of this tactic began. All this happened during my rotations at OSUV and OUV. The same can be said about the use of ground robotic platforms - in six months, from March to August, it went from the first attempts to mass use. That is, being a member of the military administration, I was able to see for myself how the tactics of conducting military operations change in half a year, how technological innovations become common tools for use on the front line. — How did the situation on the Gulyaipil and Orihiv directions change during this time? —In the Gulyaipil direction, from mid-July to mid-September, the enemy actually avoided infantry attacks (for example, in August there were only two). Announcements by some Western media, in particular the German newspaper -Bild-, about the preparation of a massive offensive by Russians from Pologhi to Gulyapole, although they alarmed the inhabitants of the Zaporizhzhia region, did not come true. In fact, there were no drastic changes in the nature and actions of the enemy, and no signs of the formation of an offensive group were detected. Then I kept stressing it, calming the audience down. I believe that I have fulfilled my mission, and this was true and objective information. In August, several units of brigades and battalions of the armed forces of the Russian Federation were redeployed from Zaporozhye to the Kursk direction. Thanks to this, the threat to Gulyaipol has decreased. In the Orikhov direction, the main fighting took place around the Robotynsky ledge. There, the enemy had little tactical success in some places, but for more than half a year of attempted assault actions, the Russians were still not able to completely -drain- the salient, which was deoccupied by the Defense Forces of Ukraine in 2023. In some cases, on the contrary, our units improved their tactical position, established or restored observation posts, firing positions. It was in this direction that the Russians suffered the greatest losses in manpower and equipment. In the Dnieper operational direction, as I have already mentioned, at the beginning of my term of office, units of the Defense Forces were withdrawn from the village of Krynka to other positions and continued to conduct a defensive operation, also on the left bank of the Dnieper, about which there was appropriate communication. At the same time, in all directions, the Russians actively used artillery, attack drones, such as Lancet and Privet. Also, the enemy massively used drops from drones and strike aircraft - hit with KABs (guided aerial bombs) and NARs (unguided aerial missiles). Our units also inflicted complex fire damage on enemy positions. —The reports of the Tavria military intelligence agency often referred to the use of chemical weapons by the Russian military. Please tell us more about it. — Every month, the Command of the Support Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine provides general statistics on chemical attacks by Russian troops against the Defense Forces and conclusions on their dynamics. The messages of the spokesperson of the -Tavria- OUV referred to a part of these statistics in a specific operational area. During the period of large-scale armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, the enemy, along with the use of conventional means of fire damage, uses special ammunition equipped with dangerous chemical substances against the Defense Forces. The definition of -chemical weapons- in relation to these munitions is incorrect, but the use of munitions with poisonous substances in war is also expressly prohibited by the Convention on the Prohibition of the Development, Production, Stockpiling and Use of Chemical Weapons and on their Destruction.) This is, in particular, the use of hand gas grenades by the enemy type K-51 and RG-VO, which are means of combating riots and prohibited for use as means of warfare. Mostly Russians use chloracetophenone. Formally, it is not a chemical weapon. It is a combat poison of irritant action. The Chemical Weapons Convention defines chloroacetophenone as a chemical anti-riot agent. It is a chemical that can quickly cause irritation of the senses or physical disorders in the human body, which disappear after a short time after the action ends. That is, tears, snorts, fogging and the like. The enemy, in addition to violating the Convention, is clearly aware of the effectiveness of these applications. Because the very means of fighting street riots is to arm the police to get the protesters to disperse and cease their actions. In the event of the use of dangerous chemicals at the front, the serviceman remains at his position - continues to be in a chemically dangerous environment. These are deliberate actions of the enemy to violate and injure our troops through the use of dangerous chemicals. For example, there is a dugout or a trench, the Russians try to demolish them with artillery, drops from UAVs, FPV drones, sometimes UAVs. Despite this, several servicemen continue to hold defense in the dugout. When occupiers see the ineffectiveness of other means of destruction, they use munitions containing poisonous substances, which are prohibited by the Chemical Weapons Convention. Thus, during August, the enemy dropped 196 munitions with poisonous substances from UAVs in the operational area of ​​the Tavria air defense system. Relatively more - in the Zaporizhzhia region, but also in the Kherson region, many such cases were recorded. - As for incendiary ammunition, how often did the Russians use them? What exactly? — In addition to poisonous substances, the enemy uses drops with incendiary substances. This is another set of weapons based on using the combat capabilities of incendiary substances to destroy defensive positions. The statistics of their use are much lower than the discharge of ammunition with poisonous substances. The Russians resorted to this tactic, in particular, on the Dnieper islands, where it is easy to cause a fire and in this way forced the o/s to leave the position. —You kept statistics of enemy losses in the South. Can you share the general results for the time you were in the position of the spokesperson of the Tavria military command center? - Daily filling of tables in Exel format is a convenient way to track the trends of combat operations, both in terms of the number of assaults and shelling, as well as in terms of damage statistics. In July, the enemy lost 1,371 units of weapons and military equipment in the operational zone of the -Tavria- anti-aircraft missile system, in August - 1,041, and in the middle of September - about 400. That is, the statistics gradually decreased. These are the data based on the daily official summaries of the -Tavria- OUV. —Finally, I want to return to the question of the main message that, in your opinion, military communicators should convey to society. What and how should Ukrainians be informed first of all? - The task of military communicators is to maintain constant communication between the fighting army and the rest of society. To do our best to ensure that this connection is not lost, because a part of our society, perhaps, the further from the front line, the more calmed down it is. And the further from the beginning of a full-scale invasion, the less the desire to mobilize, the stronger the desire to sit in the rear. In fact, nothing is over. In my opinion, the best way to communicate in the military is objective information, as well as communication of problems that have been solved. I believe that problems cannot be kept silent, they must be identified and responded to. At the same time, we should also talk about many real positive points that exist in the army. It should also be explained that the Armed Forces of Ukraine, the Defense Forces of Ukraine as a whole, is a large complex organism in which there is a place for everyone. Perhaps, and within the limits of his civilian profession. Because the army also needs builders, tractor drivers, truck drivers, accountants, lawyers, cooks, journalists - almost all civilian specialties. After becoming military personnel, they will actually continue to work in their profession, but at the same time will be part of the Defense Forces and will contribute to the defense of Ukraine, while receiving decent financial support, benefits and public respect.

In the Toretsk direction, the occupiers stormed the Toretsk and Shcherbinivka districts 14 times today. There, as well as near Shcherbinivka, enemy aviation was active. The Russian occupiers are most active in the areas of Myrolyubivka, Promenya, Hryhorivka, Selidovoy, Lysivka, Sukhoi Yar, and Petrivka. Nine clashes in the direction are still ongoing. Enemy attacks were repelled by our soldiers near the settlements of Illinka, Vozdvizhenka, Novoselidivka, Novodmytrivka, Sontsivka, Maksimilianivka, Antonivka, Dalnye and Katerynivka. In the direction of Vremivka, the enemy tried 13 times to break through to Trudovoy, Konstantinopolsky, Uspenivka, and Makarivka, but our courageous defenders stood in the way of this. Eight attacks have already been repelled. At the same time, the enemy actively used aviation means of destruction in the areas of Andriivka, Velyka Novosilka, Novodarivka and Zelene Pole settlements. As reported by ArmyInform, occupiers became active in the Vremivsk direction.

Title: Cartridges are collected even in Britain: at Interflex, automatic machines are -falling apart-
Description: The correspondent of ArmyInform tells about rifle training during the BZVP within the borders of the Interflex multinational training mission on the territory of Great Britain. Most of us hold a machine gun for the first time in our lives, so we don't notice anything strange. However, Ukrainian instructors accompanying us during training in Britain, as well as those who served in Ukraine, note the unusualness of the Kalashnikov assault rifles issued to us for training. Indeed, this is not an AK-74 or any other modifications common in Ukraine, such as the AKS, although at first glance, and especially from a distance, it is difficult to distinguish them even for an experienced shooter. However, if someone who has dealt with the AK family of automatic weapons in Ukraine takes the weapon issued by the British in his hands, he will see a lot of differences, some of which are quite significant. How Britain trains the Ukrainian military in Great Britain / BFBS Forces News report The most noticeable detail that immediately catches the eye is the bright yellow muzzle, which is neither a muzzle brake nor a flamethrower . This is a compensator device that is an adapter for blank firing. It is designed to contain and divert powder gases to the side during firing with a blank cartridge. However, it is not this most noticeable detail that determines the fundamental difference between the machine guns issued to us and the AK-74, because if necessary, a similar or similar compensator can be installed on any model of the AK family. The fundamental differences are different and not so obvious until you pick up the weapon. Among the details that are immediately obvious even to a novice, the most noticeable are also the unusual folding tubular stock and the duplicate safety / fire switch on the pistol grip under the right thumb. With the example, the situation is about the same as with the adapter for blank firing - nothing fundamentally different from the usual AK modifications. The second fuse, on the other hand, is actually a very unusual thing that will cause a number of problems for some of us. The caliber of cartridges is also unusual - these are not the traditional 7.62 mm or 5.45 mm cartridges on our territory. It is a caliber of 5.56 mm of the NATO standard, intermediate in its power between cartridges for pistols and cartridges for rifles. This caliber was adopted as the second standard service rifle cartridge for NATO forces in 1980. Since then, it has spread not only in the countries of the North Atlantic Alliance, but also beyond it. After all, even replicas of the AK, the main individual small arms of the USSR and the Warsaw Pact Organization, which were the main antagonists of NATO during the Cold War, began to be produced under the 5.56 mm cartridge. In particular, such modifications were created in Bulgaria by the armory company -Arsenal-. The most famous Bulgarian modifications of the Kalashnikov assault rifle, including those chambered for the 5.56 mm cartridge, were the AR-M1 / AR-M1F and AR-M9 / AR-M9F. The letter -F- is used to denote the folding tubular metal stock, which helps to identify the AKs made by Arsenal's Bulgarian gunsmiths. Due to the availability of a significant number of 5.56 mm cartridges, the Ministry of Defense of Great Britain purchased and uses for training Ukrainian military Kalashnikov assault rifles of the AR-M9F model. This particular model has a right-hand thumb safety/fire switch and a folding tubular stock, as well as a number of other less significant features such as a polymer buttstock or pistol grip. Ukrainians train with Bulgarian AKs manufactured by Arsenal We get used to the weapons we receive quite quickly - they are really high-quality and easy-to-use automatic weapons for training in handling weapons and shooting during basic general military training. In terms of basic parameters, the AR-M9F is almost identical to the AK-74. However, the AR-M9F has a number of disadvantages. Oddly enough, it's primarily a collapsible tubular stock and a duplicate safety/fire switch on the pistol grip. These improvements of the Bulgarian gunsmiths created some problems for some of us. It is really very convenient to remove the weapon from the safety or to put the machine on the safety with a slight movement of the thumb of the right hand. However, the AK-74 in Ukraine does not have such an improvement, so the instructors forbade the use of a duplicate fuse. In conclusion, those of us who, for the sake of speed, tried to use the fuses on the sleeves without the instructors noticing, did ourselves a disservice. After returning to Ukraine, they had to get used to the usual AK-74 fuse. However, there were practically no offenders who regularly used a backup fuse. The instructors were vigilant, and we ourselves understood how negative the consequences of faulty muscle memory can be on the battlefield in Ukraine. Instead, the problem with the tubular stock was of a different nature. After long-term use in some submachine guns, the butt assembly attachment loosened, which obviously had an extremely negative effect on the accuracy and accuracy of the shot. To prevent this, we were forbidden to make an example. The ban on folding the stock helped, but not enough - as a result of long intensive training, the machines could not withstand and sometimes practically -crumbled- in someone's hands. It cannot be said that it was too massive, but the depletion of weapons was significant. So the aiming bar, which fell off during shooting due to vibration, did not surprise anyone. To be fair, the problematic weapon was replaced immediately. My first machine gun, which regularly jammed from the first day of shooting, was replaced already on the next field trip. After that, there were no problems with the re-received weapon until the very end of the training. In the same way, problematic submachine guns were also exchanged for other soldiers of the platoon. The British were extremely careful with their weapons and meticulously inspected them for the slightest complaint. Our Danish instructors demanded of us the same careful attitude towards the machines. The instructors were no less scrupulous about collecting cartridges after training. However, such vigilance when it came to empty cartridges was caused not in any way by the need to count all the fired cartridges and collect all the casings from them, so that the number of cartridges issued clearly coincided with the number of cartridges. During the firing of empty cartridges, no one counted their number, so it was possible to replenish the ammunition, filling the stores to the brim, as needed at any time. I think that each of us fired about 800 to 1,200 blank rounds during training. However, the lack of record of empty cartridges did not exempt from the obligation to carefully select cartridges in thick grass or among fallen leaves and brushwood. This was done in order not to pollute the environment, and also because the collected cartridges were processed for the production of new batches of empty cartridges. What's more, cardboard boxes from cartridges, which were asked not to be torn, were also collected in a separate bag. These neatly opened boxes were not thrown into the trash, but were also to be used for repackaging cartridges. Such -recycling- in the British way may seem trivial to someone, but a combination of care for the environment, frugality and strict adherence to really useful and important rules cannot fail to command respect. By demanding compliance with these and other simple rules, the instructors strengthened our discipline, brought up a responsible, cautious and careful attitude to weapons, taught us to strictly observe safety measures. All this later came in handy during the firing of live cartridges, when the instructors' requirements for compliance with safety measures and cartridge control became significantly stricter.

Title: How the Armed Forces forced the Buryats to jump: the story of a soldier who mastered everything from...
Description: How is it to be on the defensive when you are assaulted three times a day? What tricks do the occupiers resort to on the front line? The soldier told our correspondent about this: -In the summer of 2022, I took part in the assaults. It was the Neskuchny, Velika Novosilka district. After one of the storms, I went to the hospital: I was wounded in my right heel, it was torn by a splinter. Nothing like that, the bones were intact, just tore the foot… In 2023, we were assigned to the 1st tank division and held positions near one of the villages in the south. It was already autumn-winter last year. It was difficult there, the enemy attacked us three times a day. In such difficult situations, the most important thing is that the soldiers in the positions do not withdraw into themselves, continue to communicate with their comrades, and listen to experienced fighters. It is important to take more ammunition to the position. Because this is not a very good option when the fighter takes a lot of stew, and BC - only four stores. If you yourself do not bring more BC to the position, then no one will do it for you. During the war, I mastered many types of weapons, from the RPG-7 to the M-240 and the Browning M2, but I loved the RPG the most. Because you can take this -pipe-, as it is called, and walk with it: I can find shots in almost any trench, ammunition is in everyone, they are interchangeable. Once upon a time, we carried out assault operations in Velika Novosilka. And there, the enemy AGS started working on our boys. Then the group commander told us to try to suppress him. This AGS behind the houses stood diagonally to us, and we saw it a little. With two shots from the RPG-7, we didn't just suppress him, we cut him down altogether. In one of the settlements in the south, I remember, we had two positions. The commander then ordered me to install American Claymore mines in front of them. It is an analogue of the Soviet MON-50. And then one day the Russians came to storm us again. They always entered from three sides: in the center and from two flanks. The battle began and we blew up those Claymores on both the left and right sides. Then the enemy was well mowed down by these mines. Then we captured two Russians. We squeezed them in a pincer between our two positions. One 19-year-old boy from Kamchatka did not hesitate. And the second one - a Buryat, he was 40 years old - even jumped on a mine in order to destroy the convoy group and himself. In the same area, the Russians had a custom of making -horseshoes- from their corpses. Because all the plantations there were already destroyed, only the stumps themselves. Then the occupiers placed three corpses of their comrades in front of them between two tree stumps, they also placed them on their sides and made a window between the bodies to conduct fire. In the same way, Russians often hid under the bodies of their dead after assaults in order to save their lives. Because then our drone could not see them very much.

Title: -Crush- everything: Israeli designers have created a laser installation that will shoot down UAVs, m...
Description: How informs the official portal of this high-tech weapons manufacturer from Haifa, the latest defense equipment was recently presented at the largest military exhibition in North America AUSA, which is organized by the Association of the US Army, reports ArmyInform. The device Lite Beam (-Light beam-, in Ukrainian) is designed to quickly neutralize aerial threats, including swarms of drones. This 10 kW laser system is designed to enhance force protection during mobile ground operations, combining economy with cost-effective use. Lite Beam is part of Rafael's strategy to expand the use of directed energy weapons to counter a variety of air and ground threats. This mobile model is an adaptation of the Rafael system Iron Beam (- Iron beam- - in Ukrainian), a fixed laser with a power of 100 kW, capable of destroying targets at a distance of several kilometers. These weapons can be mounted from light vehicles and deployed in a variety of operational areas, allowing to counter a wide range of threats, from drones and missiles to mortar shells. In addition, the system can neutralize identified improvised explosive devices (IEDs) and other ground-based threats, increasing its versatility on the battlefield. The new version of the Lite Beam presented at AUSA 2024 has an updated increased power compared to previous models of 7.5 kW, matching similar systems such as Jupiter from MBDA and Rheinmetall. With an effective range of several hundred meters to approximately 2 km, the Lite Beam excels in its ability to accurately track targets with an advanced tracking system that can also be integrated into other anti-drone systems (C-UAVs). Design modularity allows the Lite Beam to be installed on a variety of platforms, including armored vehicles, ships, and fixed land platforms. As for the source of consumed energy, this combat laser station can be powered by diesel generators or batteries depending on the operational needs. One of the key features of the Iron Beam is its lower cost per shot compared to conventional interceptor missiles. Each Iron Beam intercept is valued at $1,000, which is significantly lower than the $40-$50,000 per Tamir missile the Israelis use in the Iron Dome (-Iron dome- in Ukrainian) from the same Rafael. Other international players are rapidly developing high-energy laser technologies: in particular, MBDA, Rheinmetall, Lockheed Martin and Raytheon are also developing 10 kW solutions. Among them is the ATHENA from Lockheed Martin allows multiple lasers to be combined to achieve an output power of 30 kW, while HELWS from Raytheon is designed for extreme mobility and can be mounted on a simple pickup truck. Although this technology is still in the early stages of development with many systems being researched or tested, it offers promising potential for future defense applications. Lite Beam's ability to provide fast and accurate laser protection in a mobile format highlights Rafael's achievements in this field, positioning it as a potentially strategic tool to counter emerging threats. The Rafael laser installation has an unlimited -store- of cartridges, which allows you to use it without the need for reloading. In addition, no fragments of intercepted targets remain after the shot, which reduces the risk of collateral damage. According to the authors of the publication Army Recognition, this is especially important in the context of the conflict in Israel, where the country's air defense forces faced a shortage of ammunition for Iron Dome. Analysts cite data from Israeli economists who note that the war in Gaza has already cost the Israeli economy more than $67.3 billion, but the use of high-energy lasers such as Iron Beam or British DragonFire, about which in its publications repeatedly ArmyInform told, it also has its own problems. Atmospheric conditions such as clouds or rain can affect the ability of the beam to reach the target. Because the laser must remain focused on a moving target for several seconds to provide enough energy to destroy it. This requirement can limit its effectiveness against multiple threats at once, such as a barrage of missiles. In addition, some targets may be protected by materials resistant to laser attacks, which may reduce the effectiveness of the system. High-energy Iron Beam laser weapons system. Video: Rafael

Title: And again, nuclear blackmail: the Russian Federation took out a dirty bomb from the closet
Description: However, in reality, such statements are part of the systematic nuclear blackmail of the Russian Federation, aimed at discrediting Ukraine, and are false. Russian statements about the so-called -dirty bomb- serve as a cover for its own actions that pose a threat to international nuclear security. This is written by the Center for Strategic Communications and Information Security. Russia itself has repeatedly threatened to use nuclear weapons, occupied the Chernobyl nuclear power plant, and also provokes fears about possible incidents at the Zaporizhzhia and Kursk nuclear power plants. Russian forces are also moving tactical nuclear weapons to Belarus and conducting exercises using the nuclear arsenal, which is causing concern to the world community. Such Russian fakes aim not only to discredit the Ukrainian leadership, but also to divert attention from their own crimes in the nuclear arena. Statements about the possibility of Ukraine using nuclear weapons are purposeful propaganda aimed at undermining international trust in Ukraine and justifying further nuclear escalation on the part of Russia.

Title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy spoke about the new agreements on military aid
Description: About this he said in the evening address. According to the President, France has decided on the missile package, and also continues the heavy training program of our soldiers. He also said that there is a solution that allows contractors from the US to work in Ukraine to repair and maintain equipment. -We are working with our partners from the United States of America on new defense packages that support our air defense system. And this is something that is absolutely necessary before winter, in the conditions of constant Russian strikes. We need real progress in long-range as well,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. The head of state also thanked Canada for working together with us on the supply of additional air defense systems NASAMS. -There is this week a new decision of Britain on sanctions against Russian entities working for the war — and that is also very important. Thank you! All legal entities and individuals of Russia, which ensure the activity of the Russian military industry, should be cut off from the world — to reduce Russia's ability to avoid real diplomacy and further inflame the war,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy said. The President noted that a new military package from Lithuania is currently being prepared. Work is also underway to attract funds for the purchase of weapons and production in Ukraine. -Sweden - there are new solutions and in civil support, and in the military, in particular for our maritime security,- Volodymyr Zelenskyy added.

Title: Grants for startups in the defense sector: applications for the training program have been announced
