Title: The World Bank will allocate 750 million dollars to Ukraine to support reforms and reconstruction
Description: reported Prime Minister of Ukraine Denys Shmyhal. According to him, the funds will be provided within the framework of the project -Support for reconstruction through prudent fiscal management- (SURGE), which is aimed at supporting the institutional reforms necessary for joining the European Union. Part of this amount will be allocated from the ADVANCE Ukraine fund, which is supported by the Japanese government. As Denys Shmyhal noted, the implementation of the program will help to strengthen the work of state institutions in the conditions of war, to provide key state services to citizens in full. In particular, the reforms within the project are aimed at improving the efficiency of public investment and public finance management. If necessary, funding can be increased. -We are grateful to the leadership of the World Bank and our international partners for this important support to Ukraine in the conditions of a full-scale war unleashed by Russia,- the Prime Minister noted. As reported by ArmyInform, Great Britain introduced new sanctions against the Russian OPC.

Title: Ukraine receives a new weapon: Estonian anti-drone missiles
Description: About this it was discussed at a meeting in Kyiv between the Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine, Brigadier General Anatoly Klochka, and the management of the specified company. The missiles that Ukraine will test are designed primarily to counter UAVs and are capable of hitting targets at a height of up to 2 km. -Our goal is to help Ukraine win this war. For this, we offer a sample of a new low-cost missile for shooting down aerial targets, primarily unmanned aerial vehicles,- said Frankenburg Technologies CEO Kusti Salm. He added that in the case of successful tests and approval for further use, the production of these missiles can be organized in Ukraine. The parties have previously agreed that the next step may be to agree on the format of financing the production of missiles. Deputy Minister of Defense Anatoly Klochko emphasized that it is extremely important for Ukraine to have the widest possible arsenal of missile weapons to repel Russian aggression. He called on foreign manufacturers of such weapons to provide them in Ukraine and test them in combat conditions. -We are open to cooperation and ready to use various types of modern weapons,- the deputy minister said. As reported by ArmyInform, the Minister of Defense of Ukraine Rustem Umyerov, together with the Chief of the General Staff, Lieutenant General Anatoly Bargilevich, held a meeting with the military to discuss the real needs of the army and further steps for its modernization.

Title: Hurivske - a settlement in Odesa region was named in honor of Military Intelligence
Description: This is reported by the Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. The relevant decision was adopted with the aim of marking the important contribution of the Ukrainian special services to the protection of national interests from external threats, strengthening the defense capabilities of our country and honoring the feats of military intelligence officers. In the explanation of the Institute of National Memory of Ukraine, it is stated that during the large-scale war with Russia, the soldiers of the HUR performed a complex of complex tasks — from strategic intelligence to combat operations to liberate Ukrainian lands, as well as special missions in the occupied territories and behind enemy lines, which undermine the military potential of the aggressor state. -We express our gratitude to the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine, the team of the Institute of National Remembrance of Ukraine, and the local community of Hurivskyi for the important decision and commemoration in toponymy of the feat of the HUR soldiers,- the message reads. The name Hurivske, which honors the state rank of the Military Intelligence of Ukraine, is not accidental for Odesa: it symbolizes the persistence of historical traditions in the creation of national special services. For example, it was in Odesa in 1886 that Vsevolod Zmienko (1886-1938), a prominent military figure of the Ukrainian Revolution of 1917-1921, a corporal-general of the Army of the Ukrainian People's Republic, one of the organizers of the military special service of the State Center of the Ukrainian People's Republic in exile, was born. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in Kyiv Oblast four men were hit by fragments of a downed rocket.

Title: The situation at the front is difficult: the Armed Forces of Ukraine held off almost 150 Russian ass...
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The aggressor carried out airstrikes, in particular in the areas of Yunakivka, Krasnopillya, Myropyllya, Vodolagi, Zhuravka, Basivka, Tsapivka, Kozacha Lopan, Okhrimivka, Vovchansk, Visoka Yaruga, Novovodyane, Terny, Torske, Yampil, Elizavetivka, Rivne. The defense forces repulsed the offensive actions of the enemy in the direction of Petropavlivka, Kruglyakivka, Kindrashyvka, Kolisnikivka, and Lozova. In the Pokrovsky direction, our defenders stopped 24 offensive actions of the aggressor in Myrolyubivka, Promenya, Lysivka, Krutoy Yar, Hryhorivka, Sukhoi Yar and Selidovoy districts. The main efforts of the enemy were concentrated in the districts of Illinka, Novoselidivka, Kreminnaya Balka, Novodmytrivka, Sontsivka, Maksimilianivka, Antonivka, Dalnyi and Katerynivka. In the Dnieper direction Russian invaders attacked our positions three times. They were fiercely repulsed and suffered losses. In the Volyn and Poliske directions no signs of the formation of enemy offensive groups were detected. We will remind, last day of loss Russian invaders numbered 1,580 people. Title: A blow to Kharkiv: the entrance of a house was destroyed, a three-month-old baby was among the injur...
Description: This was reported by Oleg Synegubov, the head of Kharkiv OVA. The enemy again attacked the Saltiv and Shevchenkiv districts of the city. In the Saltiv district, a 12-story residential building was hit, where rescuers continue to clear the rubble. According to preliminary data, 25 people were injured, five of them were hospitalized, their condition is assessed as medium and light. 30 people were evacuated, including four children. The entrance of the building from the 1st to the 3rd floor was partially destroyed, neighboring residential buildings, five cars and the exits of the metro station were damaged. The youngest boy among the victims is 3 months old and has an acute reaction to stress. Fortunately, there are no injured people in serious condition. In the Shevchenkiv district of the city, Russian aircraft struck an open area, damaging historical buildings, public places and residential buildings. Another hit occurred near residential buildings, where at least six high-rise buildings, shops, shopping pavilions and cars were damaged. The metro station exits were also damaged. According to preliminary data, there are no victims in the central part. Emergency services continue to eliminate the consequences of the shelling and examine the places of hits. As reported by ArmyInform, as a result of an enemy air attack on Zaporizhzhia 40 people were injured, including four children.

Title: The F-16 protected Donald Trump, but missed the mark on tenure
Description: About the most famous use of the F-16 fighter during the incident, which could potentially become one of the attempts to assassinate Donald Trump, says ArmyInform. Patrolling of the airspace of the United States of America, including F-16 fighters, is carried out as part of the comprehensive control of North American airspace and airspace, which is provided, implemented and coordinated by the United States and Canada's Joint Aerospace Defense System. The joint US-Canadian air defense and missile defense system is subordinate to the North American Aerospace Defense Command. Abbreviated from the first letters of its name in English, it is known as NORAD. NORAD's headquarters and command center are located at the US Peterson Air Force Base, but the command is joint US-Canadian and is responsible for the airspace security of both countries. There are three regional headquarters under his command: the Alaska NORAD region at Elmendorf Air Force Base; the Canadian NORAD Region in Winnipeg, Manitoba, and the Continental NORAD Region at Tyndall Air Force Base, Florida. An F-16 Fighting Falcon from the Minnesota ANG performs a simulated interception of an aerial target during the EAA AirVenture 2024 air show in Oshkosh, Wisconsin NORAD's primary mission is to protect the sovereign airspaces of both nations by responding to unknown, unwanted, and unauthorized actions in the airspace. and the surrounding area of ​​North America. Forces and assets under NORAD monitor the airspace around the clock with the aim of detecting unauthorized actions, track air targets and, if necessary, carry out a set of measures with the aim of diverting them from their flight path, forcing them to land or destroying them if they can pose a potential threat. NORAD works in close cooperation with the US National Guard, law enforcement agencies, special services and all other components of the security and defense forces of the United States of America and Canada. Patrolling American airspace, NORAD pays increased attention to the places of stay of the President of the United States. The American media has repeatedly drawn attention to the significant increase in costs for the security of the first person of the state, including due to the fact that F-16 fighters must be constantly in the air with the support of refueling aircraft in order to provide combat air patrol (CAP) within the limits of the temporary no-fly zone around the president. During the presidential elections in the United States, the protection of the candidates for the position of the President of the United States is provided not only by the Secret Service, which is responsible for the protection of senior political figures, but also by other components of the security and defense forces of the state. This year, even the Pentagon joined the protection of candidates in the presidential elections. NORAD is also traditionally involved in patrolling the airspace in the places of rallies and other meetings of candidates for the President of the United States of America with voters. This was done both during the recent presidential race and in previous election campaigns. Increased attention to the protection of US presidential candidates is fully justified, because assassination attempts are quite frequent. Among the latest high-profile cases, we can mention the assassination attempt on the now elected US President Donald Trump on July 13, 2024 at a campaign rally in the town of Butler near Pittsburgh in the state of Pennsylvania. Then the bullet hit Trump's ear, which for a while became a symbol of the unity of the electoral core of voters around the figure of a charismatic candidate. Judging by the results of the vote, the shots to the side and next to the candidate for President of the United States ultimately contributed to his victory. However, this is far from the only and not the first time that Donald Trump's life was or could be in potential danger during the election campaign. During one of these incidents, an F-16 patrol fighter of the NORAD mission took a prominent part in preventing a possible attempt on his life. The incident occurred during a Donald Trump campaign rally on October 28, 2020 at Laughlin/Bullhead International Airport in Bullhead City, Arizona, when an unidentified aircraft entered the closed airspace without authorization, creating a potential threat to the then-current To the President of the United States of America. The pilot of the offending aircraft did not communicate with the air traffic controller and did not respond to radio warnings. NORAD's statement on the incident states: -A NORAD F-16 aircraft tracked a general aviation aircraft that failed to communicate with air traffic control and entered the temporary restricted flight area around Bullhead City, Arizona without proper clearance.- Seeing that the offending aircraft did not respond in any way to the initial interception procedures, the F-16 fighter pilot fired a warning shot, using flares to attract attention. After that, it was possible to establish radio communication with the offending aircraft and it was taken out of the prohibited zone. The firing of F-16 flares became a bright part of the pre-election show. The US president and the crowd of protesters in his support were delighted by what they saw, although they did not understand exactly what was happening. -Oh look at that! Look, look, look! They pointed to the future President! How about that?- - shouted Donald Trump, instantly noticing how to take advantage of the situation. After that, the politician, who is prone to outrage and is not picky in his words, did not forget to scold the Democrats and the American media. According to him, they never report or show anything really interesting and important, and even seem to have deliberately turned the cameras in the other direction in order not to film the F-16. It is not difficult to make sure that Donald Trump's statements turned out to be far from reality - the incident was reported in detail by dozens of local and national American media. Instead, the statement that the F-16 pointed to the future President of the United States by firing signal missiles turned out to be quite true, although somewhat premature. Donald Trump lost the 2020 presidential race then but won the current 2024 US Presidential election by a landslide.

Title: It destroys what it cannot seize: the Kremlin already realizes that it will not be able to take Odes...
Description: Military expert Petro Chernyk told ArmiyaInform about this: -Ukraine is one of the five largest countries exporting grain and leguminous crops in the world. Almost 500 million people around the world are supplied with Ukrainian grain, primarily African countries. This is a huge number. This is also a serious source of foreign currency income for our state. Therefore, the Russian strikes are aimed at reducing the export potential of Ukraine, which for grain and other crops is carried out mainly by sea. racists want to undermine our country economically. There is an important nuance. Russia is also among the top 5 grain exporting countries. The Russian Federation produces from 70 to 140 million tons per year and sells two thirds of it. So if we do not grow and sell our grain to foreign markets, then Moscow will replace us, enrich itself even more and replenish the budget for military purposes to continue the war of aggression against Ukraine. An interesting point. If the Russians set about destroying our port infrastructure, this is a sign that the Russian Federation will no longer be able to return Ukraine to its circle of interests. If the enemy understood that he could completely return Ukraine, he would not destroy the golden hen that lays the golden eggs. That is, the Kremlin already realizes that it will not be able to take Odeschyna. We need to strengthen our air defense, particularly in the south. There is a reflection on the part of South Korea regarding the transfer of anti-aircraft missile systems of their production to us. This is the Cheolmae-2 medium-range air defense system, a rough analogue of the German IRIS-T system. By the way, the Korean complex was developed using technologies from the Russian S-350 and S-400 air defense systems. Maximum range to the target: 40 km. But, again, we must understand that it will not be possible to completely close the airspace over Ukraine. Even if the maximum number of air defense systems is installed in Ukraine, there will still be a breakthrough.-

Title: -- Russians? Drop your weapon-! They didn't quit. And I shot: as Junior Sergeant Dobosh broke throug...
Description: Mr. Ilya is 48 years old. In the army - since May 2022. Joined the ranks of the 51st separate rifle battalion of the 63rd separate mechanized brigade of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Military accounting specialty is machine gunner. Behind his back is a term of service in the Crimea, in Feodosia, from 1994 to 1996, after Ukraine declared independence. Served in the ranks of the construction battalion. He recalls how his military unit could not -say goodbye- to the Soviet -stars- on their uniforms for a long time - although the neighboring unit had already switched to tridents. In civilian life, he managed to master many professions: a driver, a logger, a security guard, and a forester. Originally from Transcarpathia - from Mukachevo. -Why did I join the army in 2022? Because I understood that if everyone stays at home, then the Russians can be at my doorstep. Besides, my brothers went to war. When I learned about it, I also went to war. Do I regret going into the army all the time of the full-scale war? No,- says the army man. The military man has a number of hot spots behind him, including battles for Bakhmut. Now he is on the difficult Lyman direction. The other day, at the end of October, during combat missions, he destroyed up to 10 enemy personnel and prevented a breakthrough in his position. The military recalls: -I was just at training - mastering a new combat vehicle, MTLB. He came back on Saturday, on Monday he took a turn at the front. And here they go, 20 meters away from me. I ask: -Russians? Drop the weapon!-. They lined up like goslings. The weapon was not thrown. I shot. A few hours later, a new batch arrived. They were also shot,- the unit commander succinctly recalls. The most terrible thing, says Mr. Ilya, during a large-scale invasion was when the brothers were on one side of the battle, and he was on the other. -It was scary whether I would see them again: whether I would survive or they would survive. Then it was really scary. But everyone survived, thank God. It's hard to lose your friends… Recently, I lost a close friend: a landmine flew and he was cut by shrapnel. I pulled him out of the trench, he was dragged into the car on a stretcher, but, unfortunately, he was not taken to the hospital. Three children remained and the wife… -. Mr. Ilya suffered a concussion during those events. Now undergoing treatment. But they try to find time during the war for jokes - where would we go without that. -Once they said to the fellow: -Listen, the commander was urgently looking for you! Run as fast as you can to him!-. He rushed, ran 300 meters, and only then remembered that the commander was on vacation. He stopped and turned around - and my friends and I were lying there, laughing,- Mr. Ilya recalls. The need for people in his department is palpable, says Mr. Ilya. But he emphasizes that reliable fighters are needed. -I have to be sure of my brother - that he will not let me down and will not run away anywhere. As in his commander. And this, in fact, is one of the main tasks of the commander: the fighter should not be afraid of him. He should, by his own behavior, encourage him to perform his duty well, and not to -jump on his skis- and go home. You have to treat your soldiers humanely, otherwise he won't be a good soldier, he won't want to serve.- When asked what victory will be in the Russian-Ukrainian war, Mr. Ilya answers: -When I return to my family. When my brothers, alive and well, return to their families. Someday there will come a time when we will all gather in some cafe and sit together, remember the service, remember those who are not with us. Let's remember all the good and not so much. This will be a victory for me.- Photo from the personal archive of Ilya Dobosh

Title: The President discussed with the Secretary General of NATO the participation of the North Korean mil...
Description: This was reported by the Office of the President. The head of state talked about the situation on the battlefield, in particular about the participation of the North Korean military in the Russian aggression against Ukraine. The President emphasized that a more decisive reaction of the Western countries to the new role of North Korea in the Russian-Ukrainian war is needed. In addition, among the main topics of the meeting is the implementation of the decisions of the Washington NATO summit, in particular regarding the strengthening of air defense, investments in the Ukrainian production of shells, drones and long-range weapons. Volodymyr Zelenskyi noted that Ukraine needs permission to use long-range weapons on military facilities on the territory of Russia. Title: Jumping into holes and pretending to be a hose: the Russians are trying to save themselves somehow
Description: The head of the planning department of the 13th brigade of the operational assignment -Charter- of the National Guards of Ukraine Lieutenant Colonel Anton Baev. - They have chosen such a system - we partly forced them to this, because during their movement we constantly inflict fire damage on them, constantly hit them. They hide in those -holes- that they equip and dig on the routes of their tracking. A very large number of -burrows-, everywhere along all the routes they mainly use, he said. The guardsman described the usual tactics of the occupiers: - When the fire attack begins, there is a -hole- somewhere, where they all climb. If not everyone climbs there, then they hide under the trees. In the same case, if Russian soldiers are found while moving in open areas where there is no shelter, they fall down and pretend to be dead. — If we find them in some areas where their usual tactics are impossible, then they simply fall down and either pretend to be dead, or just lie there and not move, hoping that they will not be seen. But it doesn't work, the military man emphasized. Earlier, ArmyInform explained that prompts Russians to surrender as prisoners in Kharkiv Oblast.

Title: Volodymyr Zelensky discussed defense support for Ukraine with Emmanuel Macron
Description: This was reported by Office of the President. One of the topics of the meeting is military aid, in particular training of the Ukrainian brigade -Anna Kyivska-, strengthening of long-range capabilities. As reported by ArmyInform, on the sidelines of the summit in Budapest, Volodymyr Zelenskyi also held a meeting with the President of Moldova Maya Sandu and Prime Minister of Great Britain Keir Starmer.

Description: This was reported by Ivan Fedorov, the head of Zaporizhzhya OVA. Title: Victory plan and financial support: the President of Ukraine met with the British Prime Minister
Description: This was reported by /a> Office of the President. The main topic of the meeting is the implementation of the Victory Plan, which the head of state presented to the head of the British government last month in London. -Thank you, Prime Minister, we had frequent discussions and very important decisions regarding the strengthening of Ukraine. I thank you and all the people. We are very proud of such bilateral relations between our nations. Thank you for standing with us in this difficult period,- said the President. Volodymyr Zelenskyi noted that it is extremely important to support Ukraine with long-range weapons and to give permission for their use against military targets on Russian territory. The head of state also emphasized the importance of supporting the Ukrainian defense industry, in particular for the production of long-range UAVs and drone missiles. The President thanked the United Kingdom for the recent decision to provide Ukraine with a loan of $3 billion at the expense of profits from the frozen assets of the Russian Federation. This money is part of the $50 billion that the G7 countries have pledged to transfer to Ukraine to strengthen its defense capabilities. As reported by ArmyInform, Great Britain announced about the introduction of new sanctions against the Russian military-industrial complex, which further restricts the supply of vital military equipment that the Russian Federation needs for the war in Ukraine.

Title: Volodymyr Zelenskyi: North Korean troops have already suffered losses in battles in Kurshchyna
Description: He said this at a press conference in Budapest after the European Political Community summit. The President reported that as of today, 11,000 North Korean soldiers are present on the territory of the Russian Federation, near the northern border with Ukraine. -Part of these troops have already participated in hostilities against the Ukrainian military. There are already losses, that's a fact,- said Volodymyr Zelenskyi, without providing details about these losses. The President of Ukraine emphasized that Russia will resort to much greater use of the North Korean contingent if no retaliatory measures are taken, in particular, the use of appropriate weapons and political pressure on the Russian Federation. -Because Putin is always watching the world's reaction. I believe that today it is insufficient,- added Volodymyr Zelenskyi. As reported by ArmyInform, North Koreans will be passed off as Kalmyks, Tuvans and Buryats: it is planned to be used near Suji.

Title: Distrust and trust: what motivates Russians to surrender in Kharkiv Oblast
Description: This was told by the commander of the 13th Brigade of the operational assignment -Charter- of the National Guards of Ukraine Colonel Ihor Obolenskyi. — During several months of defense of Kharkiv Oblast, -Charter- fighters took more than a dozen prisoners. Very often, prisoners surrender already during the wounding due to despair in their troops. They understand that there is no turning back for them, so they are doing everything to ensure that our fighters allow them to survive and provide first aid, he said. The officer told the story of one captured Russian who participated in the rebellion of Yevgeny Prigozhin and the march to Moscow. — Recently, we took one captured -Wagnerian- who took part in the campaign to Moscow. In order for him to testify about this, he was given first aid, pulled out, and now he is in places where he can be interrogated and information that will be important to us be taken from him, the military officer said. Captured Russians complain of lack of support from their own Russian people and indifference from henchmen and command. — Very often they cry, complain that no one helps them, that Ukrainians treat them much better than their own people. Unlike the Russians, our soldiers help captured enemy fighters, because we understand that each of them is a possible prisoner exchange. Each of them is a possible life of a Ukrainian soldier who will be returned to our land, Ihor Obolenskyi emphasized. The Charter commander explained how important prisoner exchanges are for every Ukrainian soldier. — When we see that such exchanges happen, when our fighters return home, we see their eyes, their happiness, then for us and for all the soldiers of our brigade, this is a sign that our political power President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyi Head of Office Andriy Yermak, Parliament all in order for our fighters to return home. So we are grateful for that, said the soldier. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the Kharkiv direction, Russian soldiers are more afraid of their own commanders than of Ukrainian ones of the military, but they surrender only because there is no way out.

Title: The presidents of Ukraine and Moldova discussed countering Russian disinformation
Description: This is stated in the message at website of the head of state. Volodymyr Zelenskyy congratulated Maya Sanda on her victory in the presidential elections and emphasized the importance of coordinating the efforts of Ukraine and Moldova on the way to EU membership. The key topics of discussion are joint security challenges caused by Russian aggression against Ukraine, as well as countering Russian disinformation and its impact on parliamentary elections in Moldova next year. Volodymyr Zelensky invited Maya Sanda to visit Ukraine. As reported by ArmyInform, Russian propaganda telegram channels spread a video where a friend of a Ukrainian soldier, who was posthumously awarded the Order of Courage III degree, shows help from the state to the family of the deceased. In the video, the family is said to have been given toothpaste, antiseptic, seasoning and a sheet. The man in the video concludes that this is not the kind of help the family really needs.

Title: Reinforced concrete or earth holes: can the enemy gain a foothold in the north of Kharkiv region
Description: The head of the planning department of the 13th brigade of the operational assignment -Charter- of the National Guards of Ukraine Lieutenant Colonel Anton Baev. - Enter immediately and it is possible to pour concrete if the enemy enters and we do not have a stable line of defense. Currently, there is no such situation in our direction. We see everything that happens. We hold the lines, we are entrenched and equipped, we control all approaches, approaches of armored vehicles for 5-8 kilometers, he said. The military explained that it allows to control the actions of the enemy, who has no way to build powerful fortifications or shelters. — The enemy was forced to walk small for long distances to their positions. Sometimes even the route from point A to point B can take more than 24 hours. We see them, we accompany them. Therefore, we are not talking about any kind of concrete here, - emphasized the officer. However, this does not mean that the occupiers are not trying to fortify themselves - they are constantly digging earthen shelters. - Digging - yes, they dig all the time. They dig with a tool, they dig without a tool, but there is no concrete at the moment, Anton Baev emphasized. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the military explained the importance of evacuating civilian residents from the north of Kharkiv Oblast.

Title: The number of victims in Zaporizhzhia increased to 33 people
Description: Ivan Fedorov, the head of the Zaporizhia Regional State Administration, announced this on the telethon Edyny Novyni. -Currently, we know about 33 wounded, of whom three are children, two of them are in serious condition,- said Ivan Fedorov. According to him, the Russians used six anti-tank missiles in the city, one of them hit the oncology dispensary, where one of the doctors was seriously injured. Currently, the evacuation of the victims from the cancer center has been completed. Ivan Fedorov noted that the rescue operation is ongoing and these are not final data yet, as there may be people under the rubble. As reported by ArmyInform, the number of dead as a result of Russian strikes on Zaporizhzhiaincreased to 4.

Title: Shelling of Mykolaivka in Donetsk region: two people died, five were injured
Description: reported this by the Donetsk Regional Prosecutor's Office. A residential building became a target for the enemy. As a result of the enemy attack, two local residents were killed. At least five more civilians, aged between 60 and 77, were injured of various degrees of severity. Four women and a man with mine-explosive injuries and shrapnel injuries were taken to a medical facility, where they are provided with qualified assistance. Apartment buildings and motor vehicles were damaged in the area where the weapons were hit. The type of weapon used is set.
