Title: Russia is removed from participation in the cross-border payments project -mBridge- due to sanctions
Description: About this informs Foreign Intelligence Service of Ukraine. The project was developed by the central banks of Hong Kong, China, Thailand and the UAE with the support of the Bank for International Settlements (BIS, which unites the central banks of 60 countries of the world). The purpose of the discussion is to prevent the creation of an alternative mechanism for international transactions, as this will weaken the effectiveness of sanctions pressure on the Russian Federation. In view of the risks of participation in the project of Russia or the transfer of this technology to it, the Bank for International Settlements is considering the possibility of closing the project - the Director General of BIS A. Karstens stated that the organization will not support projects related to countries under sanctions. Earlier ArmyInform reported that the enemy is planting drugs in order to create a pretext for detaining Ukrainians at the TOT.

Title: the kremlin is strengthening its anti-immigrant policy - this will have a negative impact on the Rus...
Description: About this notifies the Foreign Intelligence Service of Ukraine. They provide for classifying the organization of illegal migration as a particularly serious crime, making decisions on the administrative -deportation- of foreigners without a trial, and creating a -register of controlled persons - foreigners- who are illegally staying on the territory of the Russian Federation. Strengthening the anti-migrant policy will have a negative impact on the Russian economy - migrants provide cheap labor in construction, agriculture, transport, service, etc. A decrease in their number will lead to an increase in the labor shortage, an increase in labor costs and a slowdown in economic growth. In addition, such a policy will worsen the Russian Federation's relations with the countries of Central Asia. Since the beginning of the year, the number of illegal migrants in Russia has increased by 40 percent. The rate of cases of organizing illegal migration increased by 5.5 times. In 2024, the number of decisions of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation to restrict foreigners from entering Russia increased by 50% to 180,000 cases. Over 106,000 violations in the field of migration legislation were recorded in ten months of this year. 20,000 people were deported from the Russian Federation, and 1,200 people were deprived of their Russian citizenship. As of October 1, 6.2 million foreigners were registered in Russia (8.5 million in 2023). At the same time, the population in Russia is rapidly decreasing. This is influenced by the declining birth rate, high mortality of young men and the outflow of citizens abroad. To maintain the population at the level of 146 million people, Russia must attract from 390 thousand to 1.1 million migrants annually. North Korean military personnel are not classified as migrants. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that 84,000 Kadyriv residents plan to die in Ukraine in the near future.

Title: The ghost of North Koreans: who dies in Kurshchyna in Russian -meat-attacks
Description: Vadim Mysnyk, the spokesman of OTU -Siversk-, told about this on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyni- . — The Defense Forces of Ukraine continue the Kursk operation. Here is the greatest enemy concentration of both [enemy] shelling and enemy manpower and equipment, he said. —The enemy is concentrating its forces precisely in this area of ​​the Kursk region, where the zone of active hostilities is taking place. The concentration of Russian forces and resources in the Kursk region is 4-5 times greater than the concentration of enemy troops in other areas in the area of ​​responsibility of the Seversk military complex. — the Russians use the tactics of meat assaults. They do not change anything - this is how they operate in Ukraine, in the Donbass and in the South, the spokesman said. The military armies of the Russian Federation are able to try to advance only by creating a significant advantage in manpower and partly in equipment. At the same time, when the Defense Forces of Ukraine destroy all enemy equipment, the Russians continue to storm continuously with small infantry groups. — Weather conditions still allow the use of equipment. But when we knock out the equipment, they continue to assault already small small groups of infantry of several people. Incessantly, literally every 10-15 minutes, they come and go, said Vadym Mysnyk. the Russians attack despite colossal losses. The military told which reinforcements the enemy sent to Kurshchyna. — There are marine brigades, and amphibious divisions, and various -storm- battalions. They are trying to carry out assault actions from different directions, but they are getting in the teeth and we are inflicting maximum damage on them, the officer said. At the same time, Ukrainian defenders do not record the participation of servicemen from North Korea in combat operations in Kurshchyna. The spokesman of OTU -Siversk- promised to provide relevant information as soon as the participation of soldiers from the DPRK in battles on the territory of the Kursk region is recorded. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that ->in Kurshchyna, Russian soldiers are wild with fear.

Title: Top ten border fighters: which units of the DPSU have the right to independently recruit new recruit...
Description: List of units and contact numbers published on the official website of the State Border Service of Ukraine. The commanders of these units can draft reservists and conscripts who have expressed a desire to do military service during mobilization. The Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine recently introduced relevant changes to the Procedure for the Conscription of Citizens for Military Service During Mobilization for a Special Period (Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine dated October 1, 2024 No. 1130 -On Amendments to the Procedure for Conscription of Citizens for Military Service During Mobilization, for a special period-). According to the changes, the list of military units whose commanders draft reservists (except for reservists who have signed a contract to serve in the military reserve) and conscripts during mobilization is determined by the General Staff of the Armed Forces for a special period. The commander of the military unit can now independently refer conscripts and reservists to the Military Medical Commission (MMC) to determine their suitability for military service. Commanders of military units are also given the right to equip combat military units at the expense of volunteers who express a desire to serve under the draft. For this, it was necessary to contact the TCC and the joint venture. How does it work? The commander of a military unit during the draft of a conscript (reservist) for military service on mobilization: After being enrolled in the lists of a military unit, servicemen are sent to educational institutions for basic general military training State Border Service. If a person does not meet the requirements due to health or professional-psychological characteristics, the commander has the right to deny him the prize. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that the military can select units for service without the participation of the TCC. Also, ArmyInform reminds you of the opportunity to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: The path to correction — former prisoners captured one and a half dozen occupiers in Vovchansk

Title: To finish off the missing - our sniper shot the remnants of the landing force from the damaged armor...

Title: UAVs and drones on optical fiber — the Ministry of Defense identified the main challenges for -Onsla...
Description: About this the Ministry of Defense announced on November 1. -Our second large-scale Hackathon is designed to unite talents to create the latest technological solutions that will help counter the enemy's means and save the lives of our military. We will turn the best ideas into real systems that will strengthen the country's defense,- said Deputy Minister of Defense for Digitalization Kateryna Chernogorenko. -Onslaught of Machines 2.0- will focus on two challenges: Challenge 1: Countering guided aerial bombs. The enemy actively uses corrected air bombs for devastating strikes from long distances. Due to their protected navigation and complex flight paths, they are difficult to intercept with traditional air defense systems. The Ministry of Defense is looking for solutions to neutralize or reduce the effectiveness of these bombs. Challenge 2: Countering fiber-optic guided drones. The enemy uses drones controlled via fiber optic communication. This makes their radio jamming impossible. The Ministry of Defense is looking for a solution to effectively neutralize these drones. You can register for the Hackathon at the link. Deadline for filling out the form: November 8. - After registration, we will inform participants about the technical details of the calls. The Defense Forces need your decisions!,- the Ministry of Defense said in a statement. As reported by ArmyInform, more than 200 participants attended a meeting dedicated to increasing the accuracy of the Defense Forces.

Title: -Beha- cleans the Russians, the occupier dies in agony, minus two BUKs: stream from the front-line c...
Description: The occupier learned the Russian method - -how to escape from reset-, but died. Seeing our drone, he started to roll from side to side to avoid being reset, but lost the game all the same. Having received numerous injuries, the Russian died in agony. These and other topics are discussed by our presenters - Major Andriy Makarenko and Captain Artem Golub.

Title: They don't have armor, or they hide it: in the Kharkiv region, enemy infantrymen justify their name
Description: The reasons for such a structure of losses of the enemy's ATS in the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyni- explained the spokesman of the Kharkiv OTU lieutenant colonel Yevgeny Romanov. - What we give in our reports, what we observe, what we work on is about one and a half hundred dead and wounded every day. Armored combat vehicles and tanks are also being destroyed, he said. At the same time, in terms of losses of weapons and enemy equipment, the enemy's road transport prevails. — About three or four times more equipment losses are caused by motor vehicles. They save armor, or they run out of it and can't replenish their resources in time - craft them or restore them, the spokesman explained. In view of the lack or insufficient amount of armored vehicles, the enemy command tries to preserve them and throws Russian soldiers into battle on maneuverable, but virtually defenseless, vehicles. Or at all forces enemy infantry to attack exclusively on foot. — They use either automobile equipment or send personnel on foot to the attack, Yevhenii Romanov said. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the north of Kharkiv region, the Russians attack on everything that has wheels, but for their equipment and infantry it is a road at one end.

Title: The state rear operator will announce purchases in all areas for 2025 by the end of December
Description: About this reported on November 1 by the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine. Advance planning and preparation will ensure uninterrupted supply of food, equipment, and fuel and lubricants for military personnel throughout the year. And for suppliers — to plan and organize production processes more harmoniously. -Early announcement of purchases for 2025 is an important step for effective planning, which contributes to providing the Armed Forces with everything they need. This approach allows suppliers to prepare for participation in tenders in a timely manner and contributes to the transparency of the procurement process. Working on forecasted planning, we strive to increase the level of provision, eliminate the risks of supply disruptions and ensure the effective use of state resources,- emphasized Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine Dmytro Klimenkov. -Planning purchases for the whole year was a challenge for us. And this is one of the main goals we set for ourselves in the first year of work. We managed to do this thanks to the joint work of the DOT, the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine and the structures of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. This synergy made it possible to qualitatively change the approach to uninterrupted and timely provision of the military. I am convinced that this will help both suppliers, who will be able to plan their activities and capacity loading, and the Armed Forces, because they will be able to focus on their main mission,- said DOT General Director Arsen Zhumadilov. In order to improve interaction with potential suppliers and manufacturers, the DOT together with the Main Directorate for the Development of Material Support held a presentation of plans for the purchase of tangible property for the next year. The market was informed about the changes in contracting conditions and qualification requirements. Also for manufacturers of tangible property, the State operator of the rear will provide training to suppliers on the preparation of documents for participation in procurement. A number of changes are foreseen in the direction of nutrition for 2025. In particular, it is planned to launch a pilot project of a new supply model for 5 regions with the direct involvement of manufacturers. In addition, product quality control will be strengthened - for this purpose, requirements for their energy value will be revised. It is also planned to involve the State Production Service in scheduled and unscheduled inspections of manufacturers and suppliers. In addition, digitalization of processes will continue, in particular, DOT-Chain will provide for the creation and processing of acts of violation of contractual obligations. And for canned products, automated control of the quantity of shipped products will be implemented. Also in the area of ​​food for 2025, DOT plans to approve and purchase new inclusive dry rations that will include the ethical, medical and religious needs of the military. Currently, technical specifications for halal rations have been approved, and technical requirements for kosher and plant-based ones are being developed. , in particular according to the NATO codification. This applies to light petroleum products as well as lubricants, oils and liquids. As reported by ArmyInform, a quarter of the Armed Forces support the introduction of inclusive suhpajkiv.

Title: - gazelle- kobzon — HIMARS hit a truck with Russians

Title: The General Staff of the Armed Forces named three directions where the enemy attacks the most
Description: Operational information as of 16:00 on November 1 was published by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. The border areas of Sumy Oblast continue to suffer from Russian airstrikes. In particular, the terrorists hit the areas of Krasnopill, Velikay Pisarivka, Zhuravka with guided aerial bombs, dropping eight anti-aircraft missiles. A number of settlements in the Sumy and Kharkiv regions were hit by artillery shelling of the terrorist army today, including Verkhnia Pozhnya, Timofiivka, Pavlivka, Rogizne, Novenke, Basivka and Pokrovka. The enemy also carried out 22 airstrikes, using 27 anti-aircraft missiles on the territory of the Kursk region of the Russian Federation. In the Kharkiv direction, the occupiers dropped two aerial bombs in the Dergachi district. In the Kupyansk direction, the enemy tried twice during the day to advance to our positions in the areas of Petropavlivka and Lozova. A battle is going on near Lozova. The aggressor increased the number of attacks to 12 in the Lyman direction. Attacked in the vicinity of Druzhelyubivka, Katerynivka, Grekivka, Makiivka, Terni and in Serebryansk Forest. Four clashes are currently ongoing. In the Kramatorsk direction, our defenders repelled one attack by the occupiers near Stupochy. In the direction of Toretsk, the enemy did not carry out offensive operations, but carried out airstrikes in the areas of the settlements of Toretsk, Petrivka and Kostyantynivka, dropping eight anti-aircraft guns. Enemy activity currently persists in the Pokrovsky direction. Clashes of varying intensity have started here 21 times today. Attacks were repulsed in the areas of Sukhoi Balka, Myrolyubivka, Mykolaivka, Lysivka, Krutoy Yar, Novogrodivka, and Selidovo. Currently, two battles are still going on in the Vyshnevo region. Fighting continues in the Kurakhiv direction. During the day, 24 combat clashes took place near Ostrivskyi, Illinka, Novoselidivka, Kreminnaya Balka, Novodmytrivka, Vovchenka, Maksimilianivka, Dalnyi, Antonivka, and Katerynivka, and 13 attacks by the occupiers are ongoing. In the Vremivsk direction, the aggressor once attacked the positions of our defenders in the Trudovoy area. The occupiers did not carry out offensive actions in the Orihiv direction, but they carried out an airstrike with ten anti-aircraft missiles on Novoandriivka. In the Dnieper direction, the operational situation has not changed significantly. The enemy conducted three unsuccessful assaults. There were no significant changes in the situation in the rest of the directions. -Ukrainian troops are controlling the situation and exhausting the enemy along the entire line of combat engagement and in the rear,- the General Staff said in a statement. As reported by ArmyInform, almost 1,500 infantrymen, dozens of BBMs and art systems: General Staff of the Armed Forces made public the losses of rf.

Title: -They are burning, burning, tearing them to pieces-: heavy fighting continues on the approaches to K...
Description: About this on the air -Social News- told acting. press officer of the 33rd separate mechanized brigade, Nazar Voytenkov. However, according to Voytenkov, it will not be easy for the Russians to break into the city of Kurakhove. It has prepared for defensive operations and there are enough fortifications. -It is obvious that the Russians have a great advantage in terms of manpower and equipment. But we are already trained in combat — we destroy strongholds and enemy equipment. They are burning, they are burning, they are being torn to pieces,- stated the acting director. press officer of the 33rd separate mechanized brigade. Earlier ArmyInform told , that if earlier the invaders stormed in the front and lost a lot of manpower, now they focused on other tactics.

Title: At the age of 23, he defended Mariupol: the story of a defender returned from captivity
Description: The story of the fighter was made public by the Mariupol City Council. In 2022, Arthur was only 23 years old, but he bravely fought against the invaders. Together with his comrades, he defended -Azovstal-, and later was captured by the Russians. During almost three years of captivity, the defender changed 8 colonies, and on November 14, 2023 (just on his birthday) he was sentenced by the Russians to life imprisonment. From that time he was in -Black Dolphin- - one of the most terrible penal colonies of the special regime in the Orenburg region. However, on October 18, Artur was put on the lists for the exchange of prisoners and returned to his native land. Currently, the defender of Mariupol is undergoing rehabilitation. Earlier, ArmyInform reported, that more than 10 private UAV schools in Ukraine were certified in October.

Title: Sappers of the Ministry of Defense cleared more than 5,000 hectares of explosive remnants of war
Description: reports this by the Main Directorate of Mine Action of Civil Defense and Environmental Security. During the week, the sappers examined and cleared: For the efficiency of the work, special equipment for mechanized demining was involved. During this period, experts neutralized 1,618 explosive objects. In total, during the work, sappers of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine removed and destroyed 411,225 explosive remnants of war. As reported by ArmyInform, military ecologists together with civilian colleagues -mizhnarodnyh-sudiv/->investigate environmental damage caused by Russian shelling in the Mykolaiv region.

Title: Grenade launchers, rifles and carbines: hidden secrets - dodge factories - in the Lviv region
Description: This is reported by the Security Service of Ukraine. The owner of the university and the rector's office enrolled conscripts for training, violating the established license volumes. This made it possible to issue -educator's- certificates and issue deferments from mobilization. During the searches, an anti-tank grenade launcher, rifles, carbines and about 5,000 cartridges of various calibers were found at the owner of the university. The attacker was arrested and taken into custody. He is accused of violating several articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine, in particular part 1 of Art. 114-1 (obstructing the activities of the armed forces), Part 3 of Art. 332 (illegal transportation of persons across the border), Part 3 of Art. 358 (forgery of documents) and Part 1 of Art. 366 (official forgery). ArmyInform reminds that it is better not to break the law or risk your life, but to use the aggregator of vacancies in the Armed Forces and recruiting centers.

Title: A dirty ditch, a smelly basement, a tight hole: Russians choose -rat race-
Description: About this on the air of the national telethon -Edyny Novyny- the spokeswoman of OTU told Luhansk- Major Anastasia Bobovnikova. According to Anastasia Bobovnikova, the tactics of such assaults are simple. One, two or three stormtroopers run from ditch to ditch, hide in basements, holes and destroyed houses. -The goal of such actions is to accumulate as much as possible before the assault actions. Such attempts are detected, in particular, by our drones and are affected as soon as possible,- said the spokeswoman of the OTU -Luhansk-. Previously ArmyInform reported that 35 assault attempts were repulsed in the Pokrovsky direction - the enemy is trying to advance in microgroups of two or three people.

Title: Wind instrument orchestra - three and a half artillery regiments of the Russian Federation have alre...
Description: This was announced on the battalion channel by its commander, Captain Robert Brovdi. -Birds of Magyar- are famous for destroying enemy guns, piercing their barrels, after which Russian artillery turns into scrap. -150 guns are the arsenal of 3.5 separate worm artillery regiments. A little bumped. Three months already here in Donbas. Tired of that -black gold-. And the worm is incessant,- commented Robert Brovdi on the video. As reported by ArmyInform, the commander of the 414th battalion of unmanned aerial systems -Birds of Magyar- Captain Robert Brovdi laughed at the Russians, who for the twelfth time boasted about his destruction .

Title: Nothing holy - in Kyiv, a doctor and a soldier of the SZCH were detained, who are suspected of extor...
Description: This was reported on November 1 by the Special Prosecutor's Office in the field of defense of the Central region. According to the investigation, the suspects and the currently unidentified officials of the Central MSEK No. 1 of Kyiv were involved in the implementation of a criminal plan to receive an illegal benefit for the establishment of a combat veteran of the third group of disabilities for a period of 2 years, as well as for the subsequent production of all necessary medical documents for the appointment of the latter of the second group of lifelong disabilities. They noted that while the medical documents for the registration of the group will be prepared, the veteran must pay $5,000 for the previous -service-. In case of refusal, the group of disability already assigned to him will be canceled in accordance with the procedure prescribed by law. Along with this, it was previously established that the suspected serviceman voluntarily left the military unit in 2023 and is currently illegally outside its borders. The circumstances of his commission of the crime provided for in Part 5 of Art. 407 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine will be investigated during the pre-trial investigation. The suspects were detained after receiving illegal benefits in accordance with Art. 208 of the CPC of Ukraine. During an urgent search of the suspected doctor's place of residence, cash in the amount of UAH 46,000, almost $87,000, and almost 4.5 thousand euros, as well as draft records, seals of Kyiv medical institutions, and facsimiles were seized. Currently, the question of the suspect's choice of preventive measures in the form of detention is being resolved. As reported by ArmyInform, in Lviv detained an official of the regional territorial recruitment and social support center (TCC) for attempting to bribe a colleague.

Title: The enemy attacked Vovchansk and Khutory three times: a third of the occupiers' losses are irreversi...
Description: Details of the situation in the Kharkiv direction and enemy losses were informed at Kharkiv OTU. the Russian occupiers carried out 5 airstrikes using 8 air defense systems. The 41st strike was carried out by kamikaze drones. They carried out 319 shelling of the positions of defenders of Ukraine. The defense forces respond adequately to the actions of the enemy and continue to effectively destroy the manpower, weapons and military equipment of the Russian occupiers. In addition to the loss of manpower, in the Kharkiv direction, the enemy lost 83 units of weapons and military equipment destroyed and damaged, in particular: In addition, in the north of the Kharkiv region, the Defense Forces of Ukraine destroyed 53 shelters for personnel, 6 ammunition storage sites and a UAV control post. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in Kharkiv Oblast, fighters of the Third a separate assault brigade was hit by a Russian bridge-builder.

Title: October results: the Navy of the Ukrainian Armed Forces eliminated more than 2,500 Russian soldiers
Description: inform the Naval Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Estimated losses of the enemy were: The enemy continues to suffer significant losses in both personnel and equipment. The data is being verified. As reported by ArmyInform, from the beginning of the operation in the Kursk region of the Russian Federation military units and units of the Airborne Assault Troops of the Armed Forces of Ukraine inflicted losses on the enemy of almost eight thousand soldiers, which is equal to 15 enemy battalions.

Title: More than 10 private UAV schools in Ukraine were certified in October
Description: This was reported by the Deputy Prime Minister for Innovation, Development of Education, Science and Technology, Minister of Digital Transformation of Ukraine Mykhailo Fedorov. Training programs are developed based on the requirements of the Ministry of Defense, and in order to receive certification, schools must provide drones for practice and experienced instructors. The pace of private school certification remains high, and by 2025, all schools could receive the necessary permits. This opens up new opportunities for entrepreneurs and raises the standards of education in the field of UAVs, contributing to the development of the drone market in Ukraine. As ArmiyaInform reported, this year, thanks to the support of the Brave1 platform, Ukrainian developers of defense innovations attracted more than $25 million of foreign investment. This is a significant jump compared to last year, when the amount of investment was $5 million.

Title: - Is this a joke? No, the headband is red, ours. Poltyela - a Russian attack aircraft shot a video a...
Description: The video was published on November 1. In the video, a Russian attack aircraft goes with a partner to positions where there is a large amount of destroyed Russian equipment and the bodies of their fighters. Moreover, a significant part of the corpses had already been removed. The dead stormtrooper fought against Ukraine in the Avdiyiv direction, but died in Kurshchyna. As reported by ArmyInform, fighters of the 225th assault battalion carried out a successful attack on the positions of the Russians, some of which remained there forever.

Title: In Berdychev, two men were beating out a non-existent debt from the wife of a military man
Description: This is reported by the Office of the Prosecutor General of Ukraine. According to the investigation, the suspects -extorted- a non-existent debt from the common-law wife of a serviceman of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. One of them has a criminal record for fraud and is accused of theft. In September 2024, extortionists scheduled a meeting of the victims and demanded to pay them UAH 50,000. The woman denied any debt. She was threatened with physical violence and blackmailed into disclosing confidential information. Under psychological pressure, the victim took the laptop to the pawnshop and paid part of the debt. The suspects demanded to hand over the rest of the money, and in case of contacting the law enforcement officers, they threatened with physical violence. The final deadline for the payment of funds was also established. Fearing for her life, the woman was forced to collect another amount. After receiving UAH 10,000 from the victim, both men were detained in accordance with Art. 208 of the CPC of Ukraine. They are currently being held in custody without bail. As reported by ArmyInform, the SBU detained in the Sumy region a former deputy of the Shostka City Council from the banned -Party of Regions-, who worked for the Russian FSB and helped carry out attacks on Ukrainian military and civilian objects.

Title: North Koreans will be passed off as Kalmyks, Tuvans and Buryats: it is planned to be used near Suzhi
Description: About it on the air -Public News- reported </.a. The enemy continues to assault small groups daily - they are responsible for -night bombardments-.

Title: Ukraine is increasing its defense potential: the US is investing 800 million dollars in the producti...
Description: About this happened during the negotiations of the Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine Serhiy Boyev with the American delegation. In particular, the conversation was held with the team of the US Embassy in Ukraine led by Ambassador Bridget Brink, representatives of the US Congress and the national security advisor to the leader of the Republican Party in the Senate, Robert Karem. The parties, in particular, discussed the prospects of attracting American investments in Ukrainian defense production. Serhii Boev thanked the American delegation for the decision to invest 800 million dollars in the production of Ukrainian drones. -This year, the production capabilities of our defense industry have significantly increased and have the potential for significant further growth. Investments from the USA can give a good impetus to use the opportunities of our industry,- the Deputy Minister of Defense of Ukraine emphasized. He also informed the partners about the situation on the battlefield and current security challenges, in particular, the enemy's engagement of troops from the DPRK. The delegation from the USA agreed that Russia's cooperation with North Korea, Iran and China poses a common threat to the interests of Ukraine and the USA. In addition, the military plans of Ukraine and the needs of Ukrainian defenders were discussed. -The Defense Forces need the help of partners in restoring our brigades, as well as in training and equipping our strategic reserve,- Serhiy Boev noted. The delegation from the USA expressed interest in borrowing the experience of Ukraine in the development of the Defense Forces in the conditions of full-scale armed aggression by Russia. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine and Denmark discussed key support within fighter and air defense coalitions.

Title: The enemy hit Kherson with a rocket: there are casualties
Description: informs Kherson OVA about this. It is noted that one person was injured - a 64-year-old man who was in the building at the time of the attack. -He suffered a blast injury and a shrapnel wound to his face. Medics treated him on the spot. The information is being verified,- the message says. Also, around 11:30 in Kherson, a 25-year-old girl was injured by Russian shelling. She went to the hospital with an explosion injury and a concussion. In addition, a 67-year-old man who came under enemy fire in the Central District of the city on the morning of October 30 turned to doctors today. He received a mine-explosive injury and a head injury.

Title: -Half of the drones are flying to our positions-: more and more enemy drones are being jammed by EW ...
Description: Serhiy Tsekhotskyi, officer 59, told about this on the air of -Social News-. separate motorized infantry brigade named after Yakov Handziuk. In general, according to Serhiy Tsehotskyi, war is increasingly becoming -unmanned- in nature, without human participation. This especially applies to the use and countermeasures of drones. -I will say that we deactivated 84 enemy drones during the current 24 hours only with EW means. And before that, 91 units per day. These are those that did not fly to our positions. About half of them arrive. We destroy a certain part by fire damage,- said Serhii Tsehotskyi, an officer of the 59th separate motorized infantry brigade named after Yakov Handziuk. Earlier, ArmyInform reported that in the Kramatorsk direction, the enemy continues daily assaults in small groups - they respond with -night bombardments-.

Title: It was smoking, burning and flying: Oleksandr Syrskyi showed the massacre of the Russian troops
Description: He published a video of combat work on his channel. The Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces emphasized that the Russian occupiers are getting a well-deserved retribution for their crimes. As a reminder, Oleksandr Syrskyi called for an international reaction to the participation of the North Korean military in the war on the side of Russia. As reported by ArmyInform, the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces demonstrated how the occupiers-racers unsuccessfully drive into Ukrainian territory, where they are met by our fighters.

Title: Чекав на росію та допомагав бомбити Сумщину: СБУ затримала ексрегіонала
Description: Про це інформує Служба безпеки України. The attacker, who is 48 years old, is accused of spying for the Defense Forces and calling for Russian occupiers to strike the city. The investigation established that the suspect was covertly monitoring the movement of Ukrainian military echelons and the locations of the units of the Armed Forces defending Sumy Oblast. To collect information, he drove his own car, recording data on photos and videos. The traitor also tried to get additional information from acquaintances during conversations. The ex-deputy transferred the collected data to an FSB staff member, whose identity has already been established by the Ukrainian special service. In his reports, he not only provided coordinates, but also called for the acceleration of shelling of the city, in particular, on the buildings of territorial assembly centers. The SBU documented the agent's subversive activities and detained him at his residence in Shostka. Зловмисник був завербований фсб дистанційно в липні цього року. During the search, law enforcement officers seized a mobile phone with evidence of his criminal activity. Йому оголошено підозру за статтею про державну зраду в умовах воєнного стану. Ексдепутату загрожує довічне позбавлення волі з конфіскацією майна. As reported by ArmyInform, the SBU and cyber police a 47-year-old local resident was detained in Kharkiv, who worked for the Russian space forces, helping to configure the Condor-FKA and Obzor-R spy satellites.

Title: -Bomb- into the ground: Night drone attacks effectively deter the enemy
Description: Ruslan Gabinet, deputy commander of the 5th separate assault brigade of Kyiv, told about this on the air of the -Yedini Novyni- marathon. Ruslan Gabinet noted that the effectiveness of the use of drones increases at night, because it is easier for Russians to detect them during the day. -Night bombing protects our drones. During the day, the enemy can spot drones, visually identify them and shoot them down with small arms. He cannot do this at night. That's why we have this - we plan a fire attack at night. We mainly use the night to destroy more of the enemy's shelters,- said Ruslan Gabinet. As reported by ArmyInform, -meat assaults- in Toretsk expire, because the Russians are gradually running out and need to be replenished.

Title: -Help will be provided in spite of all circumstances-: The President praised the heroes who save our...
Description: This was stated President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy. The head of state thanked everyone who goes to the places after the Russian strikes in all our regions, dismantles debris, puts out fires, and provides first aid. And in general - ensures the salvation of our people. -Emergency services, police, medics, volunteers, everyone who joins in to save lives, Ukraine is proud of you,- added the President. As reported by ArmyInform, the attack of drones in Poltava Oblast: -budynku/->firefighters took two people out of the burning house.

Title: Our paratroopers told what losses the Russians suffered in Kurshchyna
Description: informs about this by the Command of Airborne Assault Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Thus, sanitary and irreversible losses among the Russian occupiers amounted to 7,980 people. As for the enemy's equipment and weapons, there were also serious gains here. A total of 58 tanks, 162 BMPs, 46 armored personnel carriers, 136 artillery systems, 2 rocket salvo systems, 592 vehicles, 46 EW stations and other special equipment were destroyed and damaged. In addition, 3 rotorcraft and 146 enemy drones of various types were destroyed in the air. Namely: Ka-52 combat helicopters — 2, Mi-8 — 1, reconnaissance drones — 111 of various types, attack drones — 34 (-Shakhed,- -Lancet-) and 1 Orion reconnaissance-strike UAV. It is worth emphasizing the number 9874 - that's how many enemy fpv drones were suppressed (disrupted the execution of missions) by paratroopers' EW. Significant successes of the maroon berets and in the realm of trophies. So, almost 300 enemy servicemen were captured, as well as 9 tanks, 4 armored personnel carriers, 9 guns, 6 mortars, etc.

Title: Residents of the People's Republic of Ukraine on the verge of isolation: new rules for mobile commun...
Description: This was reported by Artem Lysogor, head of the Luhansk OVA. Even on the roofs of high-rise buildings, the signal is now unavailable, making it difficult to try to stay in touch. Smartphones can be used only by representatives of the occupation administration and persons close to them. In addition, from January 2026, new restrictions on access to medical services will apply to residents of the so-called LNR. Many hospitals have already been repurposed as military hospitals, which makes access to doctors difficult. From next year, not only a Russian passport, but also a health insurance policy will be needed to receive medical care. Without insurance, only emergency medical services will remain available. As reported by ArmyInform, the Kremlin is considering a draft law which -lnr/->classifies information about the activities of the occupation authorities, in particular on the territory of the so-called lnr. This will make it possible to hide numerous crimes, including war crimes.

Title: -We are slowly burying them all-: the cemetery of the occupiers in Toretsk is growing in geometric p...
Description: Mykhailo Stoykevich, Deputy chief of staff - head of the planning group of the headquarters of the 49th separate assault battalion -Karpatska Sich-. In particular, the spokesman debunked the myth about the infinity of the Russian army and emphasized that the enemy's manpower is also running out and needs to be replenished. -They also expire, they are also replenished. We know that they have areas where they accumulate and settle. If there is a pause, it means one thing - they bring in new people, train them. And then we meet them,- said Mykhailo Stoykevich. Earlier ArmyInform reported that Ukrainian troops are holding Toretsk - the enemy has not yet advanced beyond the eastern outskirts of the city, the number of assaults is decreasing.

Title: The safety of servicemen is a priority: a new training program is being implemented in the Armed For...
Description: The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine informs about this. Within the framework of this program, approved by the Commander-in-Chief of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, General Oleksandr Syrsky, a pilot project is being implemented that extends the basic combined military training from one to one and a half months. The new program takes into account current challenges, including national and patriotic training. In October, the Main Directorate of Psychological Support of the Armed Forces of Ukraine held specialized meetings with specialized managers dedicated to improving the quality of national-patriotic training. Experienced officers and scientists visited the training centers and shared their knowledge and experience. The main purpose of these events is to form unified approaches to learning, exchange experience and find new, interesting teaching methods. It is designed to make the training process more dynamic and effective, which will contribute to improving the quality of military training and saving their lives. As reported by ArmyInform, Ukraine and Denmark discussed key support within fighter and air defense coalitions.

Title: Another devastating night in Kharkiv region: civilians and houses under enemy fire
Description: This was reported by Oleg Synegubov, the head of Kharkiv OVA. A private house and three cars were damaged by shelling in Kharkiv, Kyiv district at 21:21. A 37-year-old man and a 49-year-old woman were injured. At 2:40 a.m., a guided aerial bomb hit an open area in the village of Bilashi in the Kharkiv district. In the city of Dergachi at 21:05, the roof of a two-story building caught fire as a result of shelling. Three men were injured: 39, 42 and 64 years old. A 75-year-old man died as a result of shelling in the Kupyan region at 15:00. A 42-year-old civilian was injured in the village of Kucherivka of the Petropavlovsk community at 12:13 p.m. Fighting intensified at the front. In the Kharkiv direction, the enemy stormed three times the positions of the Armed Forces near Vovchansk and Vovchansk Khutori. In the Kupyansk direction, 15 attacks took place during the day, in particular in the areas of Petropavlivka, Kolisnikivka, Lozova and Vyshnevo. Also, as a result of intensified evacuation measures, 91 people, including one child, were evacuated from the Kupyansky and Borivskyi directions. As reported by ArmyInform, on A Russian aerial bomb caused a fire at a civilian enterprise in Kharkiv Oblast, there are casualties. We will remind you that in Kharkiv, emergency rescue work and debris removal in the 9th floor, which was targeted by the enemy with a KAB, was completed.

Title: Since the beginning of the year, the Russians have launched almost 7,000 Shaheds across Ukraine
Description: The General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine informs about this. Of these drones, 1,185 were destroyed or suppressed by Ukrainian defenders, 738 units were lost in location, and another 29 UAVs left the controlled airspace of our state. In general, since the beginning of 2024, the enemy has launched 6,987 attack UAVs on the territory of Ukraine. Mostly, enemy drones targeted civilian and critical infrastructure of Ukraine. Thanks to the professionalism and skill of the servicemen of the Defense Forces, it was possible to save thousands of lives of our people from the Russian air terror, to protect hundreds of homes of Ukrainian citizens and important state objects from destruction. Anti-aircraft missile troops, aviation, EW units and mobile fire groups continue to protect Ukrainian skies around the clock. As reported by ArmyInform, a massive night attack: in the sky over Ukraine, Air Defense Forces shot down more than 30 drones.

Title: The border between magic and reality has been erased: a prosthesis that can understand the user's in...
Description: This was reported by the Deputy Prime Minister of of Innovation, Development of Education, Science and Technology, Minister of Digital Transformation of Ukraine Mykhailo Fedorov. The new system, called MARS, uses sensors and artificial intelligence to recognize the user's muscle movements, allowing the prosthesis to -understand- the user's intentions. This makes controlling the prosthesis more natural and simple, and also opens up possibilities for controlling other technologies, including drones. The user will be able to control the drone by changing the position of the prosthesis and tensing the muscles, similar to how a computer mouse controls the cursor. Esper Bionics is currently testing a prototype and plans to launch it on the market next year. The technology shows a future where the line between magic and technology is becoming increasingly blurred. As ArmiyaInform reported, this year, thanks to the support of the Brave1 platform, Ukrainian developers of defense innovations attracted more than $25 million of foreign investment. This is a significant jump compared to last year, when the amount of investment was $5 million.

Title: Our arta hit the areas of concentration of personnel of the occupiers
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In addition, the operation in the Kursk region is ongoing. According to the available information, the Russian aviation has carried out 21 strikes using 33 anti-aircraft missiles on its territory over the past day. Our soldiers inflict significant losses in manpower and equipment on the occupying troops and actively undermine the offensive potential of the enemy in the rear. Over the past day, the missile troops and artillery of the Defense Forces hit one means of missile troops and artillery and nine areas of concentration of personnel and equipment of the Russian invaders. We will remind you that last The loss of the Russian invaders amounted to 1,460 people. Also, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed 6 tanks, 20 armored combat vehicles, 26 artillery systems, one MLRS, 25 operational-tactical UAVs, one cruise missile, 77 cars and nine units of special equipment of the occupiers. As reported by ArmyInform, there were 170 clashes with the enemy at the front: The Armed Forces repel Russian offensives under constant fire.

Title: The Russian army shelled an educational institution and houses in the Kherson region: there were cas...
Description: This was reported by Oleksandr Prokudin, head of Kherson OVA. According to him, Russian troops attacked Antonivka, Prydniprovske, Sadov, Tomina Balka, Bilozerka, Honcharne, Stanislav, Sofiivka, Nadezhdivka, Molodizhne, Beryslav, Zolota Balka, Tyahinka, Krupytsa, Dudchany, Novooleksandrivka, Novokairy, Tomarine, and Kherson. As a result of shelling, an educational institution and 11 private houses in residential quarters of the region were damaged. Due to the aggression of the Russian military, one person died, 13 others were injured. As reported by ArmyInform, as a result of the missile attack on Odesa Russian troops attacked the fire department.

Title: What a terrible suicide: the Russian hid under the car and threw himself with a machine gun, but did...
Description: About this notified and published the corresponding video in the GUR of the MOU. One of the recent strikes occurred when two groups of Russian troops stopped by the road. A Ukrainian FPV drone unexpectedly attacked them from the air, causing panic among the soldiers. One of the occupiers, having thrown down the machine gun, tried to hide under the UAZ car, but it did not save him. The video recorded episodes of a successful operation: the destruction of Russian soldiers and the setting fire to their equipment. The campaign to destroy the logistics of the Russian occupying forces at the front continues. As reported by ArmyInform, the occupiers were going to build a crossing in Kharkiv Oblast, but /->fighters of the Third Separate Assault Brigade struck their -bridge-builder-.

Title: A moment of silence in Ukraine
Description: -In order to honor the bright memory, civic courage and self-sacrifice, strength of spirit, resilience and heroic deed of the soldiers who fell during the execution of combat missions to protect the state sovereignty and territorial integrity of Ukraine, civilians who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine , decree: to start a national minute of silence every day at 9:00 a.m. for compatriots who died as a result of the armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, which should be announced in all mass media, regardless of the form of ownership,- the document says.

Title: The enemy is absent in the Black and Azov seas, but active in the Mediterranean
Description: The Navy of the Armed Forces of Ukraine reported this. In the Mediterranean Sea, 1 enemy ship, which is a carrier of Kalibr cruise missiles with a total salvo of up to 8 missiles. During the day in the interests of the Russian Federation, passage through the Kerch Strait was carried out: The Russian Federation continues to violate the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea of ​​1974 (SOLAS) by turning off automatic identification systems. As ArmyInform reported, the Russians are forced to hide in their base in Novorossiysk, but they have a new hobby.

Title: Massive night attack: in the sky over Ukraine, Air Defense Forces shot down more than 30 drones
Description: This is inform the Air Force of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. Also, the enemy attacked with 48 Shahed-type shock UAVs and drones of an unknown type from the directions of Orel, Kursk - Russian Federation. The enemy's tactical aircraft struck with guided aerial bombs on Kharkiv Oblast, Sumy Oblast and Zaporizhzhia. The air attack was repulsed by anti-aircraft missile forces, aviation, electronic warfare units and mobile fire groups of the Air Force and the Defense Forces of Ukraine. As of 08:00, 31 enemy UAVs have been shot down, 14 UAVs have been lost in location, three UAVs have flown in the direction of Belarus. Also, the Air Defense Forces managed to shoot down one Kh-59/69 guided air missile, the rest, due to active countermeasures, did not reach their targets. Anti-aircraft defense worked in Kirovohrad, Kyiv, Cherkasy, Vinnytsia, Zhytomyr, Khmelnytskyi, Sumy, Chernihiv and Poltava regions. According to preliminary results, there were no casualties. However, as a result of the Russian missile-drone attack, due to falling debris, several civilian enterprises were damaged, as well as apartment buildings and private houses in Poltava region, Cherkasy region, Kyiv region, and Odesa region. As reported by ArmyInform, there were 170 clashes with the enemy at the front: The Armed Forces repel the Russian offensive under constant fire.

Title: 170 clashes with the enemy at the front: the Armed Forces repel Russian offensives under constant fi...
Description: This is reported by the General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In addition, the enemy fired 4,241 shots, 160 of them from MLRS. The aggressor carried out airstrikes, in particular, in the areas of the settlements of Kharkiv, Varvarivka, Kozacha Lopan, Berestov, Katerynivka, Uspenivka, Kostiantynopolske, Velyka Novosilka, Roszdolne, Kurakhove, Antonivka, Ulakly, Yurkivka, Tavriyske, Mala Tokmachka and Kozatske. In the Kharkiv direction the enemy stormed three times in the areas of the settlements of Vovchansk and Vovchanski Khutory. In the Kupyansk direction, there were 15 attacks by the occupiers during the day. The defense forces repelled enemy assaults near Petropavlivka, Kolisnikivka, Zagryzovo, Lozova, Berestovo, and Vyshnevo. In the Lyman direction the enemy attacked 21 times. Tried to advance near Katerynivka, Stepovoy, Grekivka, Terni and in Serebryansky Forest. In the Kramatorsk direction, one battle was recorded in the area of ​​Chasovoy Yar. On the Toretsk direction the enemy launched three attacks near Toretsk. Title: M1A1 Abrams Weapons of Victory: Uranium Shells, Gas Turbine Engine and British Armor: American Tank ...
Description: In the 1970s, the US began developing a new main battle tank to replace the aging M60 Patton tanks. The result of this work was the M1 Abrams, which was accepted for service in 1980. Named after General Creighton Abrams, a commander during the Vietnam War, the M1 tank featured the use of composite armor (Chobham), high mobility thanks to a gas turbine engine, and the 105 mm M68A1 gun. To reduce the risks, it was decided to develop a tank according to the classic scheme with a crew of 4 and a high ballistic cannon as the main armament. Several armament options were considered: the M68 105 mm rifled gun, the British 110 mm gun and the German 120 mm smoothbore gun. The 110 mm option was rejected and the 120 mm was considered risky, leaving the 105 mm gun with the option of replacing it with a 120 mm later. During the development of the prototypes, the two companies were guided by the following basic requirements: The hull and turret of the M1A1 Abrams tank are of welded construction. The main material for the outer armor is MIL-A-11356 steel. The front parts of the hull and turret, as well as the side parts of the turret, use multi-layer armor based on the English Chobham armor. The upper front part of the case is a 50 mm steel plate. The main characteristics of the reservation: An important safety element is the presence of knockout panels, which allow to prevent an explosion in the event of an ammunition fire. Some tank modifications are also equipped with the Softkill active defense system to counter guided anti-tank missiles. Since 1985, Abrams tanks have been armed with the 120mm M256 smoothbore gun, which uses unitary projectiles with a partially incendiary case, including armor-piercing subcaliber and cumulative rounds. Due to the large diameter of the cartridges, the M1A1 ammunition was reduced to 40 rounds. Additional armament includes a 7.62 mm M240 machine gun mounted with the gun, another such machine gun near the loader hatch, and a 12.7 mm M2 machine gun on the commander's turret. The tank is also equipped with smoke grenade launchers for setting up a smoke screen. M1A1s were first used in combat during Operation Desert Storm. More than 1,800 tanks were used in the campaign to liberate Kuwait from Iraqi occupation, including 594 M1A1HA tanks and 1,178 M1A1s. The Iraqi army had about 1,000 T-72 tanks. Abrams tanks had significant advantages due to a modern sighting system, better crew training and the use of uranium ammunition. On February 26, in a battle with the Iraqi Tauvahalna division, Abrams tanks destroyed 24 T-72s, losing only 4 of their own. In the Iraq war, Abrams tanks were also actively used, but the style of their use was significantly different from the previous conflict. During the first month of fighting, 151 tanks were damaged and 2 were destroyed. By February 2005, 70% of the Abrams tanks in Iraq were damaged, of which 80 were beyond repair. In 2011, a tank company (14 vehicles) of the 1st Tank Battalion of the US Marines was deployed to Afghanistan. Tanks were used to detect the enemy, but their use was episodic due to the terrain. During the war against the terrorists of the Islamic State, 140 M1A1 tanks were given to the Iraqi army, but by the end of 2014 only 40 remained in service. And in June 2018, the Iraqis began to replace them with Russian T-90s. Ukrainian tankers especially note a number of advantages of Abrams: these are high-quality thermal imaging sights, accuracy of fire, maneuverability and reliable stabilization of the gun. Despite the considerable weight of more than 60 tons, this tank demonstrates excellent maneuverability on the battlefield. Thanks to its capabilities, Abrams effectively destroys enemy equipment and infantry, constantly adapting to the new conditions of modern warfare. In the story on the Army TV channel, the Abrams crew of the 47th Mechanized of the brigade recalls a case when they had to finish off an enemy T-62 after it was disabled by an FPV drone. This is a clear example of synergy between different types of weapons on the battlefield. Tankers note the lack of additional armor in some critical areas among the shortcomings of the tank. However, these nuances do not reduce its combat capabilities, which is demonstrated in successful operations. Lilia Borschenko for ArmiyaInform

Title: -Four friends came to our unit, still serve together-: new recruiting opportunities and experience o...
Description: Currently, this system is being worked out in many brigades, so the mechanisms of interaction between military units and TCC and SP are being honed. ArmyInform correspondents asked servicemen of the recruiting group whether the mobilization process has become easier and what opportunities volunteers have 46 separate airmobile brigade of the Airborne Assault Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. For volunteers who decided to mobilize directly through a specific military unit, there are currently two options: — come on the PPD, write a statement about the desire to serve in a specific brigade. After that, a referral to the VLK is issued to determine fitness for service. In the case of a positive conclusion, psychological tests follow, and then the processing of documents begins. For this, it is necessary to request a personal file from the TCC, but the procedure for issuing it is not yet fully worked out, the 46th brigade explains. — if a person cannot come to the PPD, he communicates with the recruiters of the brigade, who provide a sample application. The volunteer signs it, sends a scan and the original by mail. After that, a referral is made, which is transferred to the TCC for the place where the person wants to undergo the VLK. The person must pass it within the specified time. -According to the TCC procedure, the team must be informed that the volunteer has completed the VLC and send a conclusion. We already have the first person who went through this scheme, but we did not wait for the conclusion, he called and informed himself,- — says the head of the freelance recruiting group, Lieutenant Oleksandra Unknown. The TCC must also provide a list of names, according to which the mobilized person will come to the brigade, and a military ID (if he is a soldier or a sergeant). — The brigade does not issue military tickets, and without them we have no right to send a person to the BZVP. And according to the new law, after arrival and registration within three days, we must send him to study. And if a person does not have a military ticket, he will not be accepted there. And the TCC says that we do not know such a procedure. While this is a problem, — explains Oleksandra Nevydima. At the same time, a military unit can itself turn to the nearest TCC with a request to issue a military card for a specific person , who expressed a desire to serve. — This system is interesting and can help increase mobilization. It is only necessary to work out the algorithm of cooperation with the TCC. Then it will make our work easier, and people will not be afraid that even with the attitude they may not get into the chosen brigade and unit, - adds the recruiting group of the 46th brigade of the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine. In the 46th brigade of the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, they emphasize that currently the majority of new arrivals are those people who come through the recruiting system. Young people choose the specialties of UAV operators, scouts, anti-aircraft gunners or communications 8217; porters. People aged 35-45 already choose more according to their civilian specialty and experience, for example, drivers of heavy equipment, repairmen. — We had a company of four friends from Dobropill , who came together and still serve together. For us, this is only a plus. This is already a well-formed team that understands each other in half a word. They came to the TCC with our relations, we talked to the TCC and said that these four guys should get to us, — recalls Oleksandr Nevidim. She emphasizes that recruiters never promise candidates a position if it doesn't exist. Moreover, there are always back-up options, if the position is filled while the person undergoes the BZVP, this sometimes happens. They also offer an alternative if there are no positions that the candidate is interested in. — We do not hide that the brigade is conducting combat operations in the Kurakhiv direction, this is already known to everyone. A person who knows what he is going for is more motivated. When recruiting began, all units said that people come more motivated, learn better and ultimately serve better, — explain the recruiters. In 46 brigades of the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine are convinced that one of the effective ways to attract volunteers is to inform about the combat path of the military unit. It is for this purpose that a documentary series is currently being filmed about all the key events in which the brigade participated. Five series have already been released, work on the sixth is underway. — A year ago, on the Day of Airborne Assault Troops, the idea arose to shoot a documentary series. The first series was devoted to the Makarov operation, where three battalion tactical groups of the 95th brigade were involved. From there, the birth of the 46th brigade began — on April 5, 2022, it was these 3 BTGr that formed the basis of the brigade, — says the head of the communications department of the 46th OAeMBr, Lieutenant Oleksandr Nevidimy. The series also tells about the coordination of the brigade, the long operation in the Kherson region and its liberation, and then about the battles in the East — in Bakhmut and Soledar. Work is currently underway on a new episode about the brigade's participation in the Zaporozhye counteroffensive in 2023. — Our fourth battalion broke through defense of the enemy at Robotyn, and the then battalion commander Oleg Dmytrouk was awarded the title of Hero of Ukraine for this operation. We tell you how it really was at the level of our brigade. And so that the enemy does not tell it in his own way and does not distort it, - explains Oleksandr Nevymidy. A well-known Ukrainian producer helps the paratroopers of the 46th brigade of the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine to create the series Ihor Kondratyuk. — No one from the military offered me this. I liked the idea. This is a young brigade, and if we do not write its history, then the Russians can write it. It helps awareness one hundred percent. People who are currently considering whether to join the military can see real servicemen, sergeants, officers, commands, how the brigade structure works. Such awareness must be there. Reports from the brigades — are important stories for mobilization. To choose a brigade, you need to know it at least a little from the inside, — he notes. Recently, the 46th Brigade of the Armed Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine organized a two-day intensive for civilians. It is also part of the unit's recruiting campaign. Participants received all the necessary equipment. Among them were volunteers, wives of the dead and missing, as well as ordinary civilians who understand that war affects everyone. More you can read about this intensive in the ArmiyaInform report. We also remind you of the opportunity to use aggregator of vacancies in ZSU on our website. Photo by Natalia Kravchuk/ArmyInform

Title: The Colombian podcast turned out to be in Spanish: the Russians are dispersing another fake about vo...

According to Article 47 of the Additional Protocol 1 to the Geneva Convention, foreign citizens who officially fight in the armed forces of one or another party conflict, are not mercenaries. Title: The occupation authorities carry out the systematic militarization of Ukrainian children at the TOT

Title: The European Commission presented a report on Europe's readiness to respond to crises
Description: About this informs the Foreign Intelligence Service of Ukraine. The document, along with the economic report of M. Draghi (Prime Minister of Italy in 2021-2022) on European competitiveness is part of the strategy of U. von der Leyen to strengthen the strategic capabilities of the EU and the role of the European Commission. The report emphasizes that the world is facing a new reality and focuses on Russian aggression against Ukraine, the pandemic and climate change. This requires changes in policy approaches and security measures from the EU countries. S. Niynisto states that today the EU's ability to respond to threats is slowed down by -institutional, legal and political limitations that make it difficult to quickly unite the relevant actors to manage the crisis.- The main proposals: creating the EU's own common defense treaty to provide assistance to one of the member states in the event of external aggression. The document should supplement NATO's collective security mechanism; endowment of the EC with broad functions in the field of defense and reorientation of 20% of the EU budget to security needs; creating within the EC a central hub for coordination between different sectors and increasing situational awareness; expansion of the powers of the Intelligence and Situation Center (EU INTCEN), including the collection of intelligence with the help of EU diplomatic missions and the conduct of counterintelligence operations; increasing military support to Ukraine to offset US aid in the event of a reduction. It was emphasized that the European Peace Fund, as a quick extra-budgetary instrument, should be provided with sufficient resources. At the same time, the document emphasizes the need to promote the integration of the Ukrainian defense industry into the defense industry of the European Union. Title: Economic problems in the Russian Federation are intensifying
Description: About this informs Service of foreign intelligence of Ukraine. In particular, it is about: Record acceleration of inflation. Consumer prices from October 22 to 28 increased by 0.27% (last week - 0.2%), and in annual terms the indicator increased to 8.61%. The last weekly price increase close to 0.3% was recorded at the beginning of July, and this was explained by the indexation of housing and communal services tariffs. Deficit of agricultural goods. On October 27, the Russian Federation began importing butter from Turkey. 20 tons of it have already been imported in two days. Exhaustion of budget funds for social programs. On October 30, the largest Russian banks (-Sberbank- and -VTB-) stopped issuing family mortgages due to the exhaustion of the limits allocated by the government for this program. At the same time, -Sberbank- increased interest rates on family mortgages above the established limit: in Moscow and St. Petersburg, the average rate will be 9.4%, and in other regions - 10%. According to estimates, the Russian authorities will continue to increase the tax burden on citizens and businesses in order to fill the budget and compensate for the costs of the war against Ukraine and expenses for national projects by withdrawing working capital from the population. Title: A citizen of the Russian Federation will be tried in Finland for war crimes committed in Ukraine
Description: This is informs the Office of the Prosecutor General of Ukraine. The charges are related to the activities of the suspect in the -Rusych- unit, who fought on the side of the so-called -LNR-. According to the Finnish investigation, the suspect, as the deputy commander of the unit, participated in actions that violate the laws and customs of war. As a result of these actions, he and the soldiers of the unit killed 22 Ukrainian servicemen and seriously wounded four. In addition, he is accused of actions contrary to the laws and customs of war regarding the manner of conducting hostilities and the treatment of wounded and killed enemy soldiers. The charges are treated in Finland as international crimes under Finnish law. The suspect cannot be extradited to Ukraine, so Finland has launched its own investigation. The charges in the trial are brought by two prosecutors who specialize in war and international crimes. In 2016, Ukrainian law enforcement officers reported suspicion of the said person for participating in a terrorist organization (Part 1 of Article 258-3 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine). In August 2023, the Prosecutor General's Office sent a request for the detention and temporary arrest of this person. After communication with the Finnish side, the suspect was detained by the competent authorities of this country. In September 2023, the Prosecutor General's Office sent a request for his extradition. In December 2023, the competent authorities of Finland began their own investigation into the crimes of this person committed during the hostilities in Ukraine. During the investigation, the Finnish National Bureau of Investigation (NBI) cooperated with the Ukrainian Office of the Prosecutor General and the Security Service of Ukraine. At the request of the Finnish side, the Office of the Prosecutor General provided the materials collected as part of the Ukrainian investigation and assisted in the collection of evidence. In addition, the NBR exchanged information with Europol, Eurojust and the International Criminal Court.
